1006794,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1006794,"Application Engineer / HR Data Migration (f/m/d) (Berlin, DE)",E.ON,,,,,"E.ON Digital Technology GmbH | Permanent | Part or Full time
You have a passion for technology and want to make the world a greener place?
Then become a changemaker and join our team as Application Engineer / HR Data Migration (f/m/d) at E.ON Digital Technology (EDT).

We play a key role in shaping the energy transition by leading E.ON's digital transformation across Europe. We explore new paths through developing ideas, breaking new ground, making visions reality, and bringing new technologies to life. We deliver sustainable technology solutions beacuse...
... it's on us to make new energy work!
The team - your impact

As Application Engineer within the HR DT Department, you are leading the HR Data Migration concept creation, technical implementation as well as the technical quality assurance to support our Digital HR Transformation program (Delphi), that is introducing a modern HR HCM cloud solution. You are part of the HR Core Master Data Team, responsible for our future HR master data strategy in the cloud.
Your role - meaningful & rewarding
Lead HR Data Migration for Digital HR Transformation program (Delphi), ensuring accuracy, completeness, and security throughout the process
Develop and implement data migration strategies, including data mapping, transformation and validation
Take over responsibility for HR Master Data interface strategy, especially in relation to the future Oracle HCM Fusion Cloud
Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand interface requirements and resolve any issues that arise
Managing HR IT projects in the respective area, especially playing a key role in E.ON's Oracle Cloud HCM journey
Take accountability for identifying issues and driving solutions in the context of our HR Master Data strategy as well as for reducing technical and organizational dept
Your profile - authentic & open.minded
Academic degree in Information Technology, Business Administration or equivalent
Solid IT knowledge spans areas such as Oracle HCM Cloud, SAP BTP, REST, ABAP, Python, SAP HCM Payroll or similar technologies
Experience in cloud-based HCM systems or programming experience with web/ cloud technologies is part of your repertoire.
A strong self-motivation and enthusiasm for innovative solutions characterize you
Great communication skills with the ability to communicate adequately via technical and business language as well as ability to collaborate actively across cultural and organizational boundaries
Business fluent in English, German is a plus, additional language skills beneficial
Willingness to travel frequently
Our Benefits - smart & useful
Enjoy flexibility: You can combine coming to the office and working from home flexibly. It's even possible to go on workation for up to 20 days per year within Europe.

Advance your development: We grow and we want you to grow with us. Learning on the job, exchanging with others, or taking part in an individual training - our learning culture enables you to bring your personal and professional development to the next level.
Get connected: Take the opportunity to engage in our Digital Empowerment Communities for collaboration, learning, and network building.

Recharge your battery: You have 30 days of paid vacation per year plus Christmas and New Year's Eve off. Your battery still needs charging? You can exchange parts of your salary for more paid vacation or you can take a sabbatical.
Elevate your mobility: From car and bike leasing offers to a subsidised Deutschland-Ticket - your way is our way.
Think ahead: With our company pension scheme and a great insurance package we take care of your future.
This is by far not all... We are looking forward to speaking with you about further benefits during the hiring process.
Do you have questions?
For further information please contact Fabian Heller, fabian.heller@eon.com.
Please understand that for data protection reasons we can only accept applications submitted via our portal. Unfortunately, we cannot consider application documents that reach us by email or post.
What you need to know:
Job Req ID: 232513
Contract type: Permanent
Working time: Part or Full time
Company: E.ON Digital Technology GmbH
Location: Berlin, Essen, Hamburg, Hannover, München, Würzburg
Function area: IT/Digital",,,,,2024-12-01 14:59:34,,
1006198,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1006198,Data Performance Engineer,NOV,,,,,"JOB DESCRIPTION

The successful candidate will be an essential member of our service group, providing technical support to both internal and external customers of NOV. Responsibilities include determining operating performance metrics and identifying areas for improvement through equipment tuning, maintenance, and automation usage.
PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide technical guidance to field personnel within the Service group.
Providing onshore support to our Customers and Service Department relating to products and services.
Responsible for ensuring data in tracking system is accurate and up to date.
Interface with Customers and internally with the Sales, Engineering, Workshop and Rentals Departments.
Ensure job documentation is processed in a timely manner and ensure prompt and satisfactory job closure.
Analyze drilling data to assess performance, improve equipment tuning, and identify automation improvements.
Attend customer planning sessions to set KPIs, create performance reports using data visualization, and recommend actions based on analytics.
Identify anomalies, implement new analysis methods, and suggest Performance Center improvements.
Create detailed Performance Reports utilizing data visualization tools and provide analysis on current drilling and equipment operation metrics.
Provide quality service by following organization standards.
Comply with all NOV Company and HSE policies and procedures.
Perform all other duties as assigned.
FACILITY/GROUP SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES
Review and validate data received from the customer's drilling automation systems.
Drive action recommendations based on analytics and communicate to management.
Perform data profiling to identify and understand anomalies.
Implement new data analysis methodologies.
Identify and communicate opportunities for Performance Center improvement based on data analysis and customer feedback.
Assist the Performance Center teams in providing insight for troubleshooting, utilization of automated systems and recommendations for data technology improvements.
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in Engineering.
5+ years' experience in a related field desired.
Skilled with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, Grafana).
Strong knowledge of Drilling Fundamentals and Equipment.
Experience with Drilling Controls (Amphion, Cyberbase) preferred.
Proficient in Automation Systems (NOVOS, MMC).
Data analysis skills, including Excel and SQL/programming.
Experience creating reports, dashboards, and KPIs.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Ability to pass a drug screen & background check.
Must be able to work under pressure to achieve deadlines.
Ability to meet or exceed standards as established by the department.
Ability to adapt and be cross-trained to learn all job duties.
Attention to detail and a commitment to quality.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong organizational and time management abilities. Self-motivated.
Must be capable of managing multiple priorities and projects at the same time.
Superior interpersonal and communication skills.
Attention to detail and a commitment to quality.
Assertive and can drive urgency when problems arise with making new components.
Ability to drive teamwork between groups and cross functional teams.
Ability to drive issues to closure and get job done in professional and compliant manner.
COMPETITIVE BENEFITS (visit usbenefits.nov.com for more information about our benefits offerings)
401(k) Retirement Plan - NOV matches every dollar up to 5% of base pay and overtime for every dollar you invest.
Competitive medical plans that cover your entire family (yourself, eligible spouse, and eligible children) as of your first date of hire for as little as $139 per pay period (bi-weekly).
FREE preventative medical and dental care for the entire family (when enrolled in an NOV medical/dental plan and seeing an in-network physician).
FREE Basic Life and AD&D insurance (for full-time employees).
All regular full-time employees start with 3 weeks of paid vacation per year (prorated based on start date).
All regular full-time employees receive up to 11 paid holidays per year.",,,,,2024-12-01 14:59:40,,
1001343,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1001343,Senior Data Analyst & Pipeline Engineer (KDB+ Focus),Morgan McKinley,,,,,"Job Description
Location: London (preferred) or New York | Type: Full-time, Hybrid (3 days in-office)
Salary: Competitive total package (base and bonus reflective of front-office trading)

Are you a KDB+ expert looking for a business-facing role at the forefront of financial markets? We're working with a leading global financial institution to find a proactive, analytically minded professional to join their front-office trading team, driving impactful data solutions for Fixed Income and FX trading.
About the Role

This is an opportunity to work on a dynamic team responsible for building and managing data pipelines to deliver insights that inform trading strategies. You'll work closely with sales, traders, quants, and e-trading teams, translating business requirements into actionable solutions.

You'll take ownership of data pipelines, ensuring the accuracy, validation, and visualisation of raw data, creating insights such as trade statistics, hit ratios, and client analytics. You'll also play a key role in evolving their KDB+ platform, while contributing to Python-based visualisation and analytics.
What We're Looking For
Essential Skills:
Extensive experience with KDB+ (including Q queries, pipeline management, and performance optimisation).
Proven ability to collaborate with stakeholders in a front-office environment.
Strong analytical mindset with experience in cleaning, validating, and interpreting data.
Desirable Skills:
Exposure to Python for visualisation and analytics (e.g., PyKX).
Business knowledge of Fixed Income, FX, or related trading areas, with familiarity in RFQs and trade flows.
Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think strategically about data solutions.
Key Responsibilities
Lead the development of end-to-end KDB+ data pipelines to support trading and reporting.
Translate business needs into technical solutions, delivering high-impact insights.
Collaborate with sales, trading, and quants to ensure solutions meet front-office demands.
Work on the integration of Python-based visualisations with KDB+ data pipelines.
Be a proactive partner to stakeholders, contributing to discussions, presenting ideas, and driving actionable plans.
Why Apply?
Be part of a high-impact, front-office team that directly supports global trading activities.
Collaborate with a diverse group of stakeholders and shape the future of data solutions in trading.
Gain exposure to cutting-edge data technologies and broaden your skills in Python and analytics.
Competitive total compensation with career progression opportunities in a global organisation.
Next Steps
If you're a KDB+ expert with a passion for delivering data-driven insights in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, we'd love to hear from you!
Morgan McKinley is acting as an Employment Agency and references to pay rates are indicative.

Morgan McKinley encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities in the UK. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
BY APPLYING FOR THIS ROLE YOU ARE AGREEING TO OUR TERMS OF SERVICE WHICH TOGETHER WITH OUR PRIVACY STATEMENT GOVERN YOUR USE OF MORGAN MCKINLEY SERVICES.",,,,,2024-12-01 14:59:44,,
1001027,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1001027,Data Analysis Engineer - Xi'an,Emerson,,,,,"Job Summary:
Data Analysts are key in Emerson's digital strategy, analyzing data to understand customers, drive targeted marketing, and improve business efficiency, ensuring driven edge and growth.
In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:

Data collection and processing: Responsible for collecting customer-related data from multiple sources, and cleaning, integrating and standardizing to ensure the quality and consistency of the data and make it suitable for analysis.

Data analysis and interpretation: Use statistical methods and data analysis techniques to analyze data, discover trends, patterns and correlations, and extract valuable information. Combined with the actual situation of the company's products and architecture, work with the business team to transform data analysis results into actionable insights and provide business strategy recommendations.

Report writing and data visualization: Write detailed analysis reports to provide data-driven insights and recommendations to management or cross-departmental teams. Use charts, dashboards and other tools to transform data analysis results into an easy-to-understand visual format.
Model building: Develop and optimize predictive models to support business decisions.
Project management: Communicate with the demand side and complete the data project requirements, write project requirements, and realize the smooth implementation of data projects.
Technical research: Research and apply the latest data analysis technologies and tools to improve analysis efficiency and accuracy.
Complete other tasks assigned by supervisor/manager.
Who You Are:

You create teamwork allowing others across the organization to achieve shared objectives. You keep a strong bottom-line orientation.• You persist in accomplishing objectives despite obstacles and setbacks.
For This Role, You Will Need:
Communicate well across a matrix organization. Interpersonally savvy and able to collaborate and efficiently work with people at any level

Strong learning ability, proactive and meticulous work demeanor, curious about new technologies, strong initiative and sense of responsibility, critical to data, strong logic, and good stress resistance.
Bachelor's degree or above, major in computer science, statistics, mathematics, etc. or major in instrumentation automation and interested in data analysis.
3+ years related experience
Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:
Candidates with experience in data analysis, business analysis, Internet, and strategic consulting are preferred.
Fluent in English (Spoken and written) along with country language.
Familiar with data analysis methods, can use data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, Excel, PowerBI, etc.
Occupational health and safety savvy.
Our Offer to You:
By joining Emerson, you will be given the opportunity to make a difference through the work you do.

Emerson's compensation and benefits programs are designed to be competitive within the industry and local labor markets. We also offer a comprehensive medical and insurance coverage to meet the needs of our employees.
We are committed to creating a global workplace that supports diversity, equity and embraces inclusion. We welcome foreign nationals to join us through our Work Authorization Sponsorship.

We attract, develop, and retain exceptional people in an inclusive environment, where all employees can reach their greatest potential. We are dedicated to the ongoing development of our employees because we know that it is critical to our success as a global company.

We have established our Remote Work Policy for eligible roles to promote Work-Life Balance through a hybrid work set up where our team members can take advantage of working both from home and at the office.
Safety is paramount to us, and we are relentless in our pursuit to provide a Safe Working Environment across our global network and facilities.
Through our benefits, development opportunities, and an inclusive and safe work environment, we aim to create an organization our people are proud to represent.
Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their unique experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas and diversity of thoughts, that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers.

This philosophy is fundamental to living our company's values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place. Learn more about our Culture & Values and about Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Emerson.

870036,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/870036,Data Science Engineer 1,Emerson,,,,,"Job Summary

We are seeking a dynamic very hardworking to join our dynamic, multi-functional team of skilled engineers to working with powerful safe AI following best in class data science methodologies. You should have a passion for data and a strong sense of creativity, as these attributes are important for redefining industry standards and pushing the boundaries of what can be achieved through data-driven solutions.
In This Role, Your Responsibilities Will Be:
Collaborate with multi-functional teams to find opportunities to apply data-driven insights and develop innovative solutions to complex business problems.
Develop, implement, and maintain data pipelines and ETL processes to collect, clean, and curate large and diverse datasets from various sources.
Design, build, and deploy predictive and prescriptive machine learning/deep learning/large language models to help the organization make better data-driven AI assisted decisions.
Perform exploratory data analysis, data sanitizing, feature engineering, and data visualization to gain insights and identify potential areas for improvement.
Optimize machine learning models and algorithms to ensure scalability, accuracy, and performance while minimizing computational costs.
Continuously monitor and evaluate the performance of deployed models, updating or refining them as needed.
Stay abreast of the latest developments in data science, machine learning, and big data technologies to drive innovation and maintain a competitive advantage.
Develop and implement standard methodologies in data management, data modeling, code, and data quality assurance.
Communicate effectively with team members, collaborators, and senior management to translate data insights into actionable strategies and recommendations.
Active participation and contributions to innovation activities like ideathons, hackathon
Who You are:

You establish clear responsibilities and processes for monitoring work and measuring results You analyze multiple and diverse sources of information to define problems accurately before moving to solutions even in the absence of complete information You relate comfortably with people across levels, functions, cultures, and geography
For This Role, You Will Need:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field or a master's degree or higher is preferred.
1-3 years of experience with popular data science libraries and frameworks such as scikit-learn, SciPy, TensorFlow, PyTorch, NumPy and Pandas.
1-3 years of experience in data science industry projects leveraging machine learning, deep learning, transformer based large language models or any of other innovative AI technologies.
Strong programming skills in Python is must.
Knowledge of MATLAB Simulink Regression learner apps, app design will be preferred.
Solid understanding of calculus, linear algebra, probability, machine learning algorithms, Transformer architecture-based model and data modeling techniques.
Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Matplotlib or Seaborn or Bokeh or Dash.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with an ability to synthesize complex data sets into actionable insights.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present technical concepts to non-technical audiences.
Preferred Qualifications that Set You Apart:
Qualification: B.E/Post graduate in - Mathematics, Computer Science, Electronics & Instrumentation.
Basic understanding of machine learning and statistical algorithms and techniques.
Exp 2to 5 Yrs. with minimum 6months in LLM
Possession of relevant certification/s in data science from reputed universities specializing in AI.
Prior experience in engineering domain would be nice to have.

995662,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/995662,Union Data Center HVAC Engineer/ICT Service Delivery Technician,CBRE,,,,,"JOB SUMMARY

This role applies advance skills to perform preventative maintenance and corrective repairs in a Data Center operation. This exciting data center and technology focused role provides the opportunity to work on both the critical facilities equipment and IT systems running the data center, helping clients realize the potential of their critical digital infrastructure and providing growth for data center employees in the increasingly evolving data center industry.

Electrical and mechanical systems duties include (but are not limited to): Universal Power Supply (UPS) systems, generators, chillers, Electrical Distribution, HVAC systems, Building Management Systems (BMS) systems, and CMMS Work Dispatching.
Technology (IT) services include (but may not be limited to): conducting fault diagnostics/rectifying hardware failures and network channel connectivity
column2: installing, relocating, and decommissioning of DCS IT equipment (servers, switches, routers etc)
column3: cable installation, hardware upgrades, and replacing failed components
column4: and overall general maintenance & day-to-day operations compliance of the DCS IT services.

column1: ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
IT Responsibilities

- Perform hardware installations (rack / stack) and cable installations (routing, terminating,structured cabling), including troubleshooting and testing. Also, perform hardwaredecommissions and cable removal. Coordinate DCS IT asset redundant powerrequirements with appropriate facilities staff to ensure proper load balance and fail-overcapacity to avoid cascading failures.
- Prepare and coordinate incoming/outgoing shipments. Compare packing lists withpurchase details to ensure accurate make, model, and quantities are received andprocessed.

- Perform remote hands support (e.g. power cycles, physical environment, and cablinginspections, swap out failed components, hardware upgrades, testing of copper and fibercables, handling storage media, and enter troubleshooting commands).
- Grant site access to vendors and/or escort 3rd parties requiring Data Center access forapproved activities and ensure their compliance with site standards.
- Carry out daily housekeeping, rounds, reading and checks of the data halls
column2: record and report the findings

column1: Support Service Management and related processes (e.g., Service Request, Incident, Change) by creating, updating, approving, and closing associated assigned tickets.
- Ensure that Method Statements and Risk Assessments are always prepared and used for all tasks undertaken -- completing safe working practices.
- Ensure that Method Statements and Risk Assessments are prepared and used for all tasks undertaken -- completing safe working practices at all times.
CRITICAL FACILITIES SYSTEMS RESPONSIBILITIES
- Perform daily site inspections of all Mechanical & Engineering (M&E) systems and technical equipment, including servicing and maintenance.

- Under close supervision, complete assigned work according to established processes and procedures in accordance with the company's Environment, Health, and Safety Policy - ensuring all safety processes and PPE requirements are followed. Also, ensure all regulatory requirements and quality standards are complete.

- Coordinate third-party vendors, ensuring compliance with CBRE's developed processes, procedures, and all applicable laws/regulations. Accompany vendors on site visits on an as needed basis and ensure site standards are met.

- Monitor the Building Management Systems (BMS) and Electric Plant Monitoring Systems (EPMS) alarms to ensure parameters are within allowable operating bands and perform incident response when needed.

- Help build and develop work processes, Job Hazard Analysis reports, and SOPs for critical work with risk assessment. Ensure that Critical Environment Risk Management (CERM) documents and logbooks are updated.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
- No formal supervisory responsibilities in this position.
- May provide informal assistance such as technical guidance and/or training to coworkers.
- May coordinate work and assign tasks.
Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Education and Experience
High School Diploma/GED required
column2: Associates degree preferred.

column1: 2-4 years of experience in computer science, Management Information Systems, business management or a related field. Accredited training in the installation of copper and fiber structured cabling systems, preferred.
Previous experience of using Remedy, DCIM tools and BMS systems.
Knowledge of emergency response/standby/call out activities and protocols.
Strong background in either HVAC or Electrical, preferred.
Certificates and/or Licenses
None
Communication Skills
Ability to comprehend and interpret instructions, short correspondence, and memos and ask clarifying questions to ensure understanding.
Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from clients, co-workers, and/or supervisor.
Ability to effectively present information to an internal department and/or large groups of employees.
Financial Knowledge
Requires basic knowledge of financial terms and principles.
Ability to calculate simple figures such as percentages.
Experience in a financial setting working with billing and payables
column2: prior experience using a financial system
column3: and the ability to use Microsoft Excel.

column1: Reasoning Ability
Ability to understand and carry out general instructions in standard situations.
Ability to solve problems in standard situations.
Requires basic analytical skills.
Other Skills and Abilities
Ability to learn new technologies with an interest in expanding and applying this knowledge as new emerge.
A good understanding of fault diagnostic techniques including the use of handheld test equipment.
Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
An understanding of the Data Center environment, and the working restrictions applicable to such environments.
Scope of responsibility

Decisions made with general understanding of procedures and company policies to achieve set results and deadlines. Errors in judgment may cause short-term impact to co-workers and supervisor. Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visasponsorship now or in the future.

We have a long-standing commitment to providing equal employment opportunity to all qualified applicants regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, veteran status, political belief, or any other basis protected by applicable law.

Candidate Accommodations: CBRE values the differences of all current and prospective employees and recognizes how every employee contributes to our company's success. CBRE provides reasonable accommodations in job application procedures for individuals with disabilities. 960754,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/960754,Senior Engineering Data Digitalization Engineer,,,,,,"Overview:
The Senior Principal Engineer - Data Driven is responsible for leading data management and engineering digitalization efforts within large-scale oil and gas projects.
The role involves managing data integration processes across various systems, ensuring proper implementation of Smart Plant and AVEVA applications, and aligning with client digitalization strategies.
The candidate will oversee tag management, Smart Plant integrations, and interfacing with clients to address their requirements related to engineering data management and digitalization.
Responsibilities:
Lead the data-driven engineering initiatives for projects, ensuring effective data management and integration of digital tools such as Smart Plant and AVEVA applications.
Manage and oversee tag management processes and Smart Plant integrations, ensuring compliance with industry standards such as CFIHOS.
Act as a primary interface with clients to align on digitalization requirements and ensure the seamless execution of engineering data initiatives.
Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to optimize engineering workflows and ensure the smooth implementation of data-driven processes.
Ensure consistency, accuracy, and security of project data, monitoring systems for data quality and integrity.
Lead continuous improvement initiatives in engineering data management, recommending process and tool optimizations based on best practices.
Provide technical guidance on digitalization strategies, including project planning, resource allocation, and risk management.
Drive the adoption of new technologies, tools, and methodologies to enhance engineering efficiency and data-driven decision-making.
Education:
Bachelor's Degree in Engineering.
Certifications / Specialization / IT Skills:
Expertise in Smart Plant, AVEVA, and other engineering data management applications.
Strong knowledge of CFIHOS and engineering digitalization standards.
Years of Experience:
More than 16 years of experience in data management and digitalization within the oil and gas industry.
Technical Knowledge:

Data Management & Integration: Extensive experience in managing and integrating engineering data using Smart Plant and AVEVA applications, with a strong focus on tag management and Smart Plant integrations.

Client Interface & Digitalization: Proven ability to interface with clients on digitalization requirements and lead the implementation of data-driven engineering processes in alignment with client needs and industry standards like CFIHOS.

Note: Due to Visa limitations, your application will not be accepted if your nationality is Indian, Egyptian or Indonesian. Exception, if you are already a resident inside Qatar with a valid QID, transfer of sponsorship is possible!

Lead, Alteryx / Tableau/ POWER BI ADMIN - Data Platforms, GTS
BI administrator
Responsibilities:

This is a strong technology and support service delivery & operations role, accountable for installation, configuration and administration of Alteryx and Tableau platforms, user management tickets and all other 24 x 7 support and maintenance operations L1 / L2 / L3 activities.

The BI Platform Administrator will be responsible for maintaining and growing our Tableau and Alteryx platforms. The focus area of this position will be to advance the future state of self-service analytics.
Responsibilities:
§ Administer Microsoft POWER BI, Alteryx and Tableau platform and On-Premise Gateway, lead upgrade planning, configuration, and capacity planning
§ Coordinate with POWER BI, Alteryx and Tableau Premium Support and other IT team members when troubleshooting and resolving performance issues

§ Guide POWER BI, Alteryx and Tableau Dashboard developers and other colleagues during dashboard development using Alteryx and Tableau to establish and promote best practices for dashboard and data set development and -publishing (location, layout, dataset access, usage, security, performance tuning, naming conventions)
§ Optimize Workspaces and datasets to promote ease of self-service, and provide a secure, structured organization of workspaces, apps, data sets and dashboards
§ Work with business partners to migrate the existing workspaces and data sets into an organized catalog of information areas and data sets
§ Advance access control, and data security capabilities
§ Establish monitoring and service performance reporting together with operational teams
§ Automate data refreshes and other activities through scripting, and other means
§ Assess, build, and optimize new and existing reports and data visualization dashboard proto types using Alteryx and Tableau as required to triage issues, or to recommend improvements

§ Self-starter, can troubleshoot complex data problems, brings strong analytical skills with a focus on detail, thoroughness, and quality and must be a team player with strong attention to detail and able to work independently
§ Sees long term analytical business needs as primary focus, acts with a sense of urgency to resolve issues, identifies what needs to be done and takes action before being asked
§ Energetic about pushing the boundaries of what is possible, he she proposes and implements innovative improvement opportunities and ideas to evolve the BI platform

§ Has deployed and managed Alteryx and Tableau Premium in a mid-size organization, including managing users, Apps, Workspaces, and Content Packs (3 to 4 years of Alteryx and Tableau Premium, On-Prem Data Gateway, Administration experience at enterprise level in an environment with a large number of users)
§ Has proven experience performing POWER BI, Alteryx and Tableau On-Prem Data Gateway installation, upgrades and configurations
§ Has enjoyed 1-2 years of experience designing and optimizing effective BI data sets that connect to large data sources, and developing calculations
§ Enjoys dashboard development, and publishing reports in Alteryx and Tableau Premium capacities (please show work example during interview)
§ Is experienced with cmd and PowerShell scripting for automation
§ Has a solid understanding of Power BI, Alteryx and Tableau security capabilities (access control, data row-level security, use of roles to control sharing, publishing, data export)
§ Is proficient in SQL and experience in relational databases / data warehouses (Oracle, SQL Server)
§ Additional responsibilities as assigned
§ Respond to customer requests within expected Service Level Agreements and manage customer expectations
§ Review, document, troubleshoot and resolve customer's Alteryx & Tableau technical questions for the entire platform
§ Act as a facilitator and assist with the communication between customer and internal teams when escalating issues
§ Contribute knowledge to our platform support team
§ Will be required to perform upgrades, patch/fix, manage incident/problem tickets and participation in a 24/7 on-call rotation for Tableau and Alteryx platforms
Qualifications:
§ Minimum 5+ years of IT experience as a Power BI, Alteryx and Tableau system administrator, data engineer, Alteryx and Tableau dashboard developer or similar
§ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience required
§ Strong analytical skills, attitude to learn and enjoys solving complex technical problems.
§ Experience managing database connections troubleshooting (e.g., SQL Server, Redshift, Oracle, Teradata, and/or Hadoop)
§ Experience using SQL or similar technology, understands the concepts of ODBC, Oracle's OCI, APIs and connection strings
§ Comfortable working in a Microsoft environment and Windows Operating System with ability to troubleshoot server environment and/or network communication issues
§ Ability to work with end-user customers directly in a courteous and professional manner
§ Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills
§ Ability to communicate technical concepts to non-technical users
§ Ability to work in a fast-pace environment and prioritize multiple tasks
§ Knowledge of developing and scheduling jobs in Alteryx a plus
§ Experience with Business Intelligence development (Tableau, MicroStrategy, Cognos) is a plus
§ Experience with ETL tools (Informatica, IBM DataStage) is a plus
§ Experience maintaining and/or administrating computer hardware and software, file servers, firewalls and/or Active Directory is a plus
§ Experience using statistical programming tools and languages such as R, SAS, and Python is a plus
§ Experience with advanced modeling techniques to solve complex business decisions is a plus
Bonuses
§ Understanding of core AWS services like EC2, S3, IAM, and VPC.
§ Familiarity with the AWS console and basic command-line tools (AWS CLI).
§ Familiarity with data processing concepts like ETL/ELT pipelines. Basic experience with Python or Scala for data manipulation.
§ Experience with data processing frameworks like Apache Spark or AWS Glue. Understanding of data warehousing concepts and data quality practices.
§ Familiarity with data sharing mechanisms like S3 Sharing and Redshift Sharing. Sharing using Lake formation. sharing between accounts, regions
§ Basic understanding of data warehousing concepts and querying languages like SQL.
§ Basic understanding of AWS serverless services like Lambda, Step Functions, AWS Glue and Redshift Serverless.
§ Experience with CI/CD pipelines for automating infrastructure and code deployment.
§ Knowledge of cloud monitoring and logging services like CloudWatch.
§ Understanding of data lineage and data quality tools.
Business / Soft Skills:
§ Proven ability and initiative to learn and research new concepts, ideas, and technologies quickly.
§ Ability to communicate effectively, both verbal and written, excellent presentation skills.
§ Ability to work in a team-oriented, collaborative environment in a global context.
§ Willingness and ability to train and teach others.

Schneider Electric is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We believe diversity is essential to our educational mission and to the success of our community. We are committed to fostering a working environment where differences are respected, valued and embraced.
Qualifications

966059,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/966059,Subsea Data Intelligence Engineering Manager,Integer Technologies,,,,,"#LI-DNI
What we do

Integer Technologies is an applied research and product development company founded by scientists and engineers with a passion for protecting freedom with innovation. We perform R&D on next-generation systems and technologies for the Department of Defense and other U.S. Government agencies. We are hardware and software developers with experience transforming research into fieldable technology. Our core portfolio of research includes projects in power & energy systems, unmanned systems (with an emphasis on maritime systems), digital engineering, cyber security, and advanced manufacturing. Our mission is to create a safer world by translating scientific discoveries into reliable products that address urgent national security needs... at the speed of relevance.
Company Benefits
Base salaries which exceed local & national industry averages.
Year-end performance-based bonuses.
401(k) with company matching that vest immediately.

Integer fully covers medical, prescription, vision, and dental insurance costs for the employee and dependents. Meaning Integer standard plan pays 100% of health insurance premiums for your entire family from a well-known national insurer, saving its employee's thousands of dollars annually.
Relocation assistance available.
Paid vacation, sick leave, and holidays.
Paid bereavement and parental leave.
Hybrid schedule: Mondays and Fridays are optional to work from home or in the office.
About the Role

Integer Technologies is currently hiring a Subsea Data Intelligence Engineering Manager reporting to the Director of Mission Autonomy. The Subsea Data Intelligence Engineering Manager will serve as Principal Investigator (PI) on large, multi-year subsea data intelligence research programs with an emphasis on autonomous sense-making, and mission-driven use of subsea and oceanographic datasets. This role will lead the development of a decision support framework for uncrewed underwater vehicles capable of adapting in real time to changing environmental conditions. This includes maintaining the accuracy of subsea data collection and processing of that data at the edge as environmental conditions change. As part of this role, the Subsea Data Intelligence Engineering Manager will oversee the teams of engineers executing on these programs.

Many of our projects focus on using sensor-informed edge-deployed models running onboard uncrewed platforms (e.g., uncrewed surface vessels and uncrewed underwater vessels) to make real-time assessments of mission goals and provide the operators of uncrewed systems with decision aids to maximize mission outcomes. Executing this approach for maritime systems, which may involve multiple uncrewed or autonomous systems operating together to achieve a given mission, requires holistic system-wide modeling and simulation approach with a distillation of relevant factors correlated with mission outcomes. Therefore, we are particularly interested in candidates who have experience in extracting critical mission-relevant data from dense sources (e.g., modeling and simulation tools, sensors such as acoustic or magnetic, and/or machinery control systems) and translating that into actionable, mission-level information for autonomous decision making at the edge.

Integer is a science and technology research and development organization. As such, much of our work entails developing solutions for complex problems that presently have no known solutions. To achieve internal and customer project goals all candidates must be able to perform research, understand new concepts from other engineering disciplines on advanced and complex topics, and document findings in a way that is easy for non-experts to understand. The Subsea Data Intelligence Engineering Manager must be able to serve as a Principal Investigator and a technical contributor with the technical background to contribute to the development of new technologies and prototypes.
Primary Responsibilities

Serve as Principal Investigator (PI) for subsea data intelligence research programs, with an emphasis on edge processing of subsea data, including acoustic and magnetic, as well as autonomous decision making using processed data.
Be the lead authority responsible for maturing the science and technology research for the program into functional, demonstratable prototypes that address validated customer needs.
Oversee the technical, schedule, and budget performance for the S&T/R&D program and any related products that may be derived from it.
Establish a vision and plan for big picture project outcomes that align with the vision of the Director of Mission Autonomy.
Provide technical subject-matter expertise for the Company's projects related to undersea autonomy, subsea data collection, and edge processing of seafloor and oceanographic data.

Lead the development of sophisticated tools that enhance the ability of uncrewed and autonomous systems to conduct oceanographic and subsea data collection missions, including AI/ML tools, modeling and simulation suites, and optimization engines.
Lead the design of edge processing algorithms for subsea and oceanographic sensors including acoustic, magnetic, and electro-optic sensors.
Be the primary technical interface with Integer's academic research partners and serve as a liaison to government customers.
Manage, track, and review deliverables to federal customers. Ensure program deadlines are met and manage priorities for multiple programs.
Collaborate with federal sponsors to understand their missions, technology gaps, and success criteria.
Translate research into Navy relevant tools that meet specific mission requirements.
Serve as Site Lead for our Gulfport Mississippi office.
Manage all Gulfport office facilities related matters (Information Technology, building access, building security, office supplies, etc.) in coordination with relevant functional leads.
Lead engagements and maintain relationships with local partners and customers.
Identify marketing opportunities related to Gulfport office and contribute to marketing approach in collaboration with the Integer's Director of Marketing.
Manage local human resources activities (hiring, interviewing, timekeeping, etc.) in collaboration with Integer's Director of Human Resources.
Contribute to the financial planning and management of the Gulfport location in conjunction with Integer's Director of Finance.
Serve as Integer's Registered Agent for the State of Mississippi.
Lead, mentor, and manage a subsea data intelligence research and engineering group with various backgrounds and experience levels.

Provide support to other PI's when your direct reports are supporting programs other than the one for which you serve as PI. Help that PI understand the skill sets of your direct reports and identify appropriate levels of tasking for them.
Identify recruiting needs for your team, write detailed job descriptions, and lead interviews.

Translate research findings into, and contribute to, white papers and proposals for new subsea data intelligence research projects. Proactively approach potential sponsors of new research programs to send new undersea autonomy and data intelligence proposals.

Perform market analysis to identify unfilled market needs and work with the Director of Mission Autonomy to develop a roadmap for developing niche products and services that the subsea data intelligence research group can realistically develop.
Required Qualifications
Must be a U.S. Citizen with the ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. DoD Secret Clearance.

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., mechanical engineering, ocean science/engineering, marine engineering, electrical engineering, or other related field) and 5+ years of experience relevant to the primary responsibilities outlined above.

Experience conducting research on topics related to oceanographic and/or seafloor sensors and data processing, artificial intelligence, edge computing underwater uncrewed vehicles (UUVs), mission-level autonomy and decision making, or other related topics.

An understanding of digital engineering, machine learning, system modeling and simulation tools, and how to apply those tools to oceanographic/subsea sensors and data processing. This includes leading the development of modeling and simulation environments to develop and demonstrate novel autonomous reasoning capabilities based on edge-processed subsea data.
A demonstrated understanding of the Navy's mission, capability gaps, and the ability to pursue new subsea data intelligence research projects to address these needs.
Familiarity with academic research environments and interfacing with early researchers and subject matter experts.
Experience leading and managing teams of researchers, tracking program milestones and schedule, and interfacing with federal sponsors.
Comfortable with modern software engineering practices such as version control.
Experience developing software with general purpose languages in a production environment such as Python.
Excellent written and oral communication skills and technical leadership.
Ability to travel up to approximately 15% of time. This travel includes, but is not limited to, meetings with government customers, technical conferences, industry days, and off-site test events.
Additional Desired Qualifications
Masters or Ph.D. in relevant field (e.g., mechanical engineering, ocean science/engineering, marine engineering, electrical engineering, or other related field).
Experience running projects focused on pursuing the Navy's mission and filling the identified capability gaps.
Experience with in-water testing/experimentation using uncrewed or autonomous systems.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:00:45,,
966298,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/966298,TPE V / Principal Data Network Engineer,Wood PLC,,,,,"JOB DESCRIPTION
Wood is currently looking for a TPE V / Principal Data Network Engineer to work on the engineering and project management services with our Telecoms & Security team in Al-Khobar, Saudi Arabia
RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for communication system design of infrastructure projects, oil & gas upstream, downstream, refining, petrochemical design for FEED and detail design phases.
Expertise in Data Network Systems.
Originate new and revise existing engineering deliverables.
Revise and check engineering deliverables against company procedures, standards, and checklists.
Supervise engineering work being produced by juniors.
Conduct and receive trainings related to job as required.
Planning and completion of work within allocated man-hours effectively and plan work to avoid slippage.
Interfaces, coordinates and communicate effectively with the Project Manager and other team members.
Delegation and distribution work as well as manage billability of team.
Coordinates with all disciplines (as necessary) in the preparation and development of the deliverables and ensure that other disciplines input are incorporated.
Go for site visits and verify site conditions and markup drawings/perform as-built activities.
Manage deliverables submission with required quality checks and proper management of record.
Technical report writing and preparation of presentations.
Full knowledge of Aramco, Sabic, HCIS and Royal commission standards.
Technical bid evaluation, Vendor document review and subcontract scope management.
QUALIFICATIONS
An Engineering degree qualification in Electronics & Communications / Electrical Engineering qualification is essential
Minimum of 15 years' experience in the industry
Postgraduate qualifications in the relevant engineering discipline are preferred
The Communication or Network Engineer shall have a minimum of twelve years' experience in relevant telecommunication and IT work
Certified designer for outside plant cabling and structural cabling systems or BICSI certified and a copy of such certification shall be attached to the candidate's resume

962494,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/962494,Data Performance Engineer,NOV,,,,,"JOB DESCRIPTION

NOV is currently seeking a skilled Data Performance Engineer to join our Performance Center. This key role involves analyzing and interpreting drilling data to ensure optimal run performance during automated drilling operations, a crucial aspect of our contractual agreements with customers. The successful candidate will be an essential member of our service group, providing technical support to both internal and external customers of NOV. Responsibilities include determining operating performance metrics and identifying areas for improvement through equipment tuning, maintenance, and automation usage.
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Provide technical guidance to field personnel and onshore support to customers and the Service department.
Ensure accurate and up-to-date data in tracking systems.
Collaborate with customers and internal teams (Sales, Engineering, Workshop, Rentals) to ensure job documentation is timely and facilitate job closure.
Analyze drilling data to assess performance, improve equipment tuning, and identify automation improvements.
Attend customer planning sessions to set KPIs, create performance reports using data visualization, and recommend actions based on analytics.
Identify anomalies, implement new analysis methods, and suggest Performance Center improvements.
QUALIFICATIONS & EXPERIENCE
Bachelor's degree in Engineering
5+ years' experience in a related field desired
Skilled with BI tools (Power BI, Tableau, Grafana)
Strong knowledge of Drilling Fundamentals and Equipment
Experience with Drilling Controls (Amphion, Cyberbase)
Proficient in Automation Systems (NOVOS, MMC)
Data analysis skills, including Excel and SQL/programming
Experience creating reports, dashboards, and KPIs
Why Join Us?

You will have the opportunity to work in an international environment with interesting and challenging assignments. We offer excellent opportunities for professional development, attractive compensation, and stable employment conditions. You will be part of an informal working atmosphere, characterized by openness and personal responsibility, working alongside skilled professionals on diverse and impactful projects.
We look forward to welcoming a dedicated Data Performance Engineer to our team!
Apply Now and become a part of a company dedicated to innovation, excellence, and safety!",,,,,2024-12-01 15:00:55,,

993259,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/993259,"Critical Facilities Engineer, NA (HVAC/Chillers/Electrical)",Vantage Data Centers,,,,,"About Vantage Data Centers
Vantage is committed to being a workplace of inclusion, equity, respect and acceptance. We celebrate diversity and intentionally seek out opportunities to learn from one another's experience.

Vantage Data Centers powers, cools, protects and connects the technology of the world's well-known hyperscalers, cloud providers and large enterprises. Developing and operating across North America, EMEA and Asia Pacific, Vantage has evolved data center design in innovative ways to deliver dramatic gains in reliability, efficiency and sustainability in flexible environments that can scale as quickly as the market demands.
Multiple roles with target start dates in Q1, 2025.
Site Operations Department

The Site Operations Department is responsible for the overall health of all mechanical and electrical systems, building maintenance, and performance of all data modules in our data centers. The team is staffed 24 x 7 onsite with Critical Facility Engineers (CFEs) on each shift. This team is the face of Vantage to our customers and the first line of defense regarding the uptime of our campus as well as the performance of our customer installations.

Using a Critical Maintenance Management System (CMMS) to plan and track work needed, the Site Operations department performs all preventative and corrective maintenance. Our culture expects and rewards team performance that engages directly with the customers and the facility infrastructure. This is a team that does most of the actual work versus calling upon vendors. As a result, we provide superior service that is faster and more cost effective.
Position Overview

We are looking for a Critical Facilities Engineer who knows what best-in-class service looks like and can make that a reality. This role is an important member of our facilities team where we manage some of the most efficient and cost-effective data center facilities in the industry.

The successful candidate for this role will work with a team of other electrical and mechanical-focused engineers performing maintenance and repair for our data center infrastructure. We take our customer requirements for uptime seriously and keep our facilities maintained to a very high standard to insure uninterrupted service for our customers.

If you enjoy working on critical data center systems (UPSs, PDUs, Diesel Generators, ATS equipment and Building Controls), as well as industrial electrical equipment and systems that include power distribution components/wiring, electronic components and lighting systems. If you know the importance of getting it right the first time and not disrupting mission critical data centers. If you enjoy delighting customers with superior service and you have the desire and ability to do so, then please read on!
This position will be based on-site in San Antonio, TX (west side of Metro)
Essential Job Functions
Work under limited supervision, both independently and within a team environment
Manage multiple one-time and/or ongoing projects
Respond to safety and emergency situations and maintain a safe and secure work environment
Use discretion and judgment in organizing workflow and adapting as priorities are modified due to a changing environment
Frequent contact with employees at all levels of the organization
column2: frequent external contact with vendors

column1: Duties
Operate, perform maintenance and service repairs on critical Data Center systems (UPS, PDU, Diesel Generators, ATS equipment and Building Controls, Chillers, CRAH, ETC)
Develop reliability reports to ensure availability and capacity targets are achieved and maintained with 100% uptime
Coordinate, and oversee all maintenance vendors to ensure personnel safety, protect the Facility's critical equipment, and maintain power to the critical load
Create required MOPs (Method of Procedure), SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures) and EOPs (Emergency Operating Procedures) to ensure all maintenance activities are performed in accordance to them
Additional duties as assigned by Management
Job Requirements
Minimum 3 years, 5+ years preferred, of ""hands on"" experience with the maintenance and repair of industrial electrical and mechanical systems in mission-critical facilities to include
column2: emergency generators (Generators, Fuel Delivery systems and Parallel Switchgear), electrical distribution (MV/LV switchgear and associated controls), critical and essential PDUs, UPS, switchgear, HVAC, air handling units, computer grade cooling systems, and building monitoring/control systems

column1: Demonstrate knowledge in operating, maintaining, repairing, inspecting and testing critical electrical distribution systems, HVAC systems and building management/automation equipment
Ability to read commercial building blueprints and understand electrical single lines and schematics
Knowledge of commonly-used concepts, practices, and procedures related to mechanical & electrical systems needed to run data centers
Technical Writing skills and experience
column2: as well as creating, coordinating, updating and/or modifying MOPs/SOPs/EOP's for critical facilities equipment, to include supporting new systems and researching technical requirements

column1: Work experience in the electrical or mechanical field is highly desired. Strong emphasis on technical skills/training, with intent to obtain license within a reasonable time
May be required to complete formal training in an area of specialty, such as UPS maintenance
Candidates must possess reliable transportation for reporting to work for shifts, or emergencies
Travel is expected to be less than 5%, occasionally for training purposes
Potential employees must complete a background check successfully
Physical Demands and Special Requirements

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Ability to stand 1/3 - 2/3 of the time
Ability to walk 1/3 - 2/3 of the time
Ability to sit 1/3 - 2/3 of the time
Ability to climb and balance 1/3 - 2/3 of the time
Ability to stoop, kneel, crouch and crawl 1/3 - 2/3 of the time
Ability to reach with hands & arms 1/3 - 2/3 of the time
Ability to smell, talk & hear
Ability to use hands to type, handle & feel
Ability to reach with hands and arms
Ability to see at close and distance ranges and the ability to see color
Must be comfortable working in a high stress, fast paced environment with shifting priorities
Must be willing to work outside normal business hours, including weekends, late nights, holidays, and on-call support
Ability to lift up to 50 pounds 1/3 of the time
Additional Details:
#LI -Onsite
#LI-TS1

We operate with No Ego and No Arrogance. We work to build each other up and support one another, appreciating each other's strengths and respecting each other's weaknesses. We find joy in our work and each other, actively seeking opportunities to inject fun into what we do. Our hard and efficient work is rewarded with an above market total compensation package. We offer a comprehensive suite of health and welfare, retirement, and paid leave benefits exceeding local expectations.

Throughout the year, the advantage of being part of the Vantage team is evident with an array of benefits, recognition, training and development, and the knowledge that your contribution adds value to the company and our community.
Don't meet all the requirements? Please still apply if you think you are the right person for the position. We are always keen to speak to people who connect with our mission and values.
Vantage Data Centers is an Equal Opportunity Employer
Vantage Data Centers does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firm agencies. Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired
column2: such resumes will be deemed the sole property of Vantage Data Centers.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:01:04,,

864661,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/864661,Data Interfaces Architect,ABB,,,,,"Data Interfaces Architect

Take your next career step at ABB with a global team that is energizing the transformation of society and industry to achieve a more productive, sustainable future. Your role and responsibilities

Experience in tools like Azure DevOps, GitHUB, Windows debugging and Experience in identifying new tools and applying them to projects to improve quality and productivity
Improving documentation - Good grasp of reviewing design and end user documentation, reviewing and improving them

976912,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/976912,"Senior Data Analyst (České Budějovice, CZ)",E.ON,,,,,"Společnost E.ON Energie v Česku dodává elektřinu a plyn více než 1,4 milionu zákazníků. Zásobujeme energiemi domácnosti, firmy i obce a jsme jedním z největších dodavatelů na tuzemském trhu. Celá čtvrtina elektřiny, kterou nakupujeme, navíc pochází z obnovitelných zdrojů. Kromě energií zákazníkům nabízíme chytrá a úsporná řešení, jako jsou fotovoltaika, tepelná technika nebo elektromobilita.

Do našeho oddělení CRM, které je součástí Customer Value Managementu, hledáme nového kolegu nebo kolegyni na pozici Datový analytik senior. Jsme odpovědni za celý proces řízení přímé kampaňové komunikace napříč životním cyklem zákazníka pro komoditu a solutions vč. řízení a realizace cross sellových aktivit. Určujeme strategii kampaňové a automatizované komunikace se zákazníkem. Pracujeme s hodnotou zákazníka, segmentací a predikčními modely a jsme business vlastníkem všech nástrojů pro výběr, rozeslání a vyhodnocení direct marketingových kampaní a datových modelů pro zefektivňování obchodních aktivit. Přidat se k nám můžete v Českých Budějovicích a Praze.
Co u nás budete dělat?
Stěžejní částí vaší práce budou hloubkové analýzy zákaznického portfolia a jeho chování.
Očekáváme od vás precizní přípravu dat pro následné modelování a analýzy.
To se neobejde bez nutnosti komunikace s business a datovými vlastníky napříč celou společností.
Výstupy a závěry vašich analytických úloh budete interpretovat a prezentovat.
Co by měl splňovat ideální kandidát?
Dokonalost k vašim vlastnostem patřit nemusí, ale bez některých kvalit se neobejdeme...
vystudoval/a jste vysokou školu matematického, ekonomického nebo technického směru
můžete se pochlubit alespoň pětiletou zkušeností z oblasti datových a statistických analýz nebo v oblasti zpracování a vyhodnocení dat pomocí metod mechanického učení
máte prokazatelnou znalost statistických metod zpracování dat
vaše znalosti SQL, Python, případně R jsou na pokročilé úrovni
dokážete pracovat samostatně a přicházet s vlastními nápady a pohledy
analytické myšlení a proaktivní přístup k řešení zadaných úkolů je vaší silnou stránkou
angličtina v písemné formě vás nevyleká
jste pečlivý/á, komunikativní a máte týmového ducha
Budeme nadšeni, pokud...
přicházíte se zkušenostmi z energetického sektoru
se anglicky domluvíte bez potíží
již jste pracoval/a s nástroji pro statistické vyhodnocování dat (SAS, Jupyter apod.) a umíte je efektivně používat
Proč je fajn pracovat u E.ONu?
Nejspíš to zní jako klišé, ale jsme stabilní nadnárodní společnost. Nemusíte se bát, že za týden zavřeme nebo vám tři měsíce nepřijde výplata.
5 týdnů dovolené je u nás samozřejmostí.
Domů nebudete odcházet jen s výplatou, ale i s příjemnými benefity.
Při významných životních nebo jiných událostech vám dáme placené volno i nad rámec zákoníku práce.
Přispějeme vám na penzijní připojištění, ale taky třeba na stravování.
Pracovní doba je u nás pružná. Někdy je nutné pracovat o trochu déle než obvykle, jindy je zas fajn odejít dřív.
Můžete se u nás vzdělávat, rozvíjet své schopnosti a profesně růst, kam až to půjde.
ID pozice: 231958
Kde budete pracovat: Hybridní model
Datum nástupu: co nejdřív
Zaujala vás tato pracovní pozice a přemýšlíte, kam poslat životopis?

Stačí kliknout na modré políčko Přihlásit se a vytvořit si online přihlášku v naší databázi. Ozveme se vám co nejdříve! Pokud máte nějaké dotazy, můžete se obrátit na: Štěpánka Bartoňová , tel. 703 467 657.
Ve společnosti E.ON si zakládáme na férových podmínkách, příjemném pracovním prostředí, respektu a důvěře.

E.ON je mezinárodní energetická společnost v soukromém vlastnictví. Našich 75 000 kolegů ve 15 zemích každodenně spolupracuje na technických inovacích, které usnadňují životy našim zákazníkům. Jsme první velkou energetickou společností, která se intenzivně soustředí na budoucnost energie prostřednictvím energetických sítí, energie z obnovitelných zdrojů a řešení pro zákazníka.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:01:28,,

We are seeking an experienced and innovative Sr Data Program Management Specialist to join our team. In this role, you will be accountable for evaluating and enhancing data migration processes across different teams, providing Gen AI/AI/Data Science solutions, and guiding large-scale data migration projects, with a particular focus on mergers and acquisitions. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in data management, data migration, and data warehousing, along with a strong insight into ETL processes, data modeling, and database design.
Responsibilities:
- Evaluate and enhance existing data migration processes across various teams, ensuring alignment with industry best practices and organizational goals.
- Guide and oversee large-scale data migration projects, including planning, execution, and post-migration validation.
- Work with cross-functional teams, including data architects, business analysts, and IT professionals, to define migration requirements and strategies.
- Utilize Gen AI/AI/Data Science techniques to develop innovative solutions that accelerate data migration processes and improve efficiency.
- Develop detailed data migration plans, including timelines, resource allocation, and risk management strategies.

- Standardize data requirements, templates for migration, extraction strategies, testing and measuring productivity through the current Gen AI capabilities, and work with development teams to improve the tools.
- Evaluate opportunities for the application of Data Science or Gen AI or AI for data cleansing and data transformation, ensuring data quality and accuracy.
- Establish and enforce data quality standards and best practices throughout the data migration process.
- Regularly update stakeholders on migration progress, demand, and milestones.
- Provide training and facilitate end-users on new systems and processes implemented during the data migration.
- Identify opportunities for process improvements and automation within the data migration framework.
- Ensure technical teams are reusing the capabilities built and establish governance to follow the defined standards.
- Align timelines across technical towers to ensure seamless integration and migration.
Requirements:
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
- 5-8 years of experience in data management, with a focus on data migration and data warehousing.
- Proven track record of successfully guiding large-scale data migration projects.
- Strong insight into ETL processes, data modeling, and database design.
- Proficient in SQL and experienced in working with data migration tools (e.g., HVR, ADF, Informatica, Talend, SSIS).
- Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
- Ability to establish and enforce data quality standards and best practices.
- Strong communication and people-oriented skills to effectively work with cross-functional teams.
- Proactive and self-motivated, with the ability to drive projects to completion.
- Experience in aligning timelines across technical towers for seamless integration.
Preferred Qualifications:
- Master's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or a related field.
- Experience with data migration processes in mergers and acquisitions.
- Familiarity with cloud computing platforms and their integration with data migration solutions.
- Knowledge of data privacy and security regulations.
- Experience with data quality assessment and improvement techniques.

We offer a performance-driven compensation package, comprehensive benefits, and a collaborative work environment. If you have a strong background in data management, data migration, and data warehousing, along with proven experience guiding large-scale projects, we would love to hear from you. Join our team and play a crucial role in accelerating our data migration processes using Gen AI/AI/Data Science solutions
Additional Information

975337,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/975337,Data Analyst,Chevron,,,,,"Chevron is accepting online applications for the position of Data Analyst l ocated in Makati City, Philippines through December 15 , 2024 at11:59 p.m. PH Time
column2: with flexible onboarding date.

column1: Join our Team

Chevron invests on its people to build technical and professional competencies through various training opportunities, development programs, mentoring/coaching engagements , and certification courses. All are applied through experiential learning and actual practice while solving real business problems, but in a safe, supportive, and ""fail-fast"" environment.

Technology will play a crucial role in unlocking ever cleaner and more affordable sources of energy. Chevron is seeking innovative, technology professionals with a desire to thrive in the global digital environment and help us lead the global energy transition. An IT career at Chevron offers you the opportunity to work in a technical environment with a global reach. We differentiate ourselves through the application of cutting-edge technology, and by taking a collaborative approach that includes in-house expertise , proprietary solutions, and strategic partnerships. We also offer flexible work schedules and very competitive benefits.
Join Chevron IT. Grow your skills with us and enjoy a great career with Chevron.

A Data Analyst is responsible for gathering, analyzing and problem solving as it relates to data, types of data, and relationships among data elements within a business system or IT system and with business domain expertise. A Data Analyst provides expertise on how Business workflows map to data, and how data can be integrated to build reusable data products. A Data Analyst will serve as a subject matter expert for delivery teams.
As a Data Analyst , you will :
Collect, process, and analyze large datasets using Microsoft Azure services (e.g., Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Lake).
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize data insights using tools like Power BI.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.
Perform data validation and ensure data accuracy and integrity.
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in data to support business decision-making.
Document data analysis processes, methodologies, and findings.
Stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies to ensure our data analysis practices remain cutting-edge.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Data Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
We are looking for mid to senior level Data Analysts with p roven experience (at least 5 years) as a Data Analyst or similar role dealing with data and ETL processes.

Excellent communication and collaboration skills with demonstrated ability to build trusted working relationships with remote peers and stakeholders (internal & external parties) across global teams and time zones.
Collaborate within an agile mindset and seek/acknowledge diverse perspectives from others.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Azure Services & Power Platform, including Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Lake, and Azure SQL Database.
Ability to optimize analytical reports for maximum speed, efficiency, and accessibility.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Power BI, Spotfire, Tableau.
Experience with SQL and data querying languages.
Experience with Python for Data Wrangling.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail and accuracy
Proficiency in oil and gas workflows, business processes, and data types.
Data modeling techniques, data fluency and governance.
Fundamental knowledge of Information Risk Management (IRM).
Mentor junior data analyst and provide guidance on best practices.
Preferred Qualifications:
Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst certification (PL-300)
Strong understanding of the oil and gas industry.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively frame analytics opportunities and convey the findings of your analysis.
Ability to discover and prepare datasets into clean, understandable, usable, datasets for data analysis.
Knowledge of scripting languages (e.g., Python, R) for data analysis.
Working with us
There are two Chevron companies operating in the Philippines: Chevron Holdings Incorporated (CHI) and Chevron Philippines Incorporated (CPI).

CHI is a shared services center providing transactional, processing, and consulting services in the areas of finance and accounting, information technology, supply chain management, human resources, downstream customer service and marketing. Established in 1998, CHI serves Chevron affiliates in six continents around the world. Over the years, it has grown to be one of the leading members of the shared services industry in the Philippines.
CHI has received various recognitions as a top employer: the 2022 Diversity Company of the Year
column2: 2021 Asia's Best Employer Brand Award

column5: 2019 Circle of Excellence, Top Employer Category at Asia CEO Awards, and the 2018 Wellness Company of the Year at the same Asia CEO Awards.

989212,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/989212,"Data Migration Specialist (f/m/d) (Essen, DE)",E.ON,,,,,"Du möchtest reibungslose und fehlerfreie Datenmigrationen für Unternehmen realisieren?

Dann werde Teil unserer Technology Consulting Division ""Expert Services"" innerhalb der E.ON Digital Technology und arbeite gemeinsam mit uns daran, die Energiewende Wirklichkeit werden zu lassen. Als Professional-Services-Organisation arbeiten wir eng mit unseren Geschäftseinheiten zusammen und bieten Dienstleistungen, die die Umsetzung von E.ON's ambitionierter Digitalisierungsstrategie beschleunigen.
Wenn du eine Leidenschaft für Technologie und digitale Innovation hast, werde zum Playmaker in unserem energiegeladenen und vielfältigen Team von mehr als 500 Expert Services Consultants (w/m/d).
It's on us to make new energy work!
Das Team - dein Einfluss

Als Data Migration Specialist - Expert Services (f/m/d) spielst Du eine entscheidende Rolle bei der Planung, Durchführung und Optimierung unserer Migrationsprojekte, um sicherzustellen, dass unsere Kunden von nahtlosen Datenübergängen und höchster Qualität profitieren.
Deine Rolle - sinnhaft & wertvoll
Planen und Durchführen von Datenmigrationen von Quell- zu Zielsystemen.
Analysieren von Quell- und Zieldaten zur Identifizierung der Migrationsanforderungen.
Zusammenarbeit mit Projektmanagern und Datenarchitekten, um Datenintegrität und -qualität sicherzustellen.
Definition und Implementierung der Extraktions- und Migrationslogik für verschiedene Migrationsobjekte unter Verwendung bestehender oder projektentwickelter MigrationFactory-Tools.
Planung und Durchführung von Datenvalidierungstests.
Optimierung (Leistung/Automatisierung) des Migrationsprozesses.
Enge Zusammenarbeit und Wissensaustausch mit Kollegen, Fachspezialisten sowie unseren Kunden.
Dein Profil - authentisch & neugierig
Sehr gute Kenntnisse von ETL-Tools und -Technologien wie Talend, Informatica oder SSIS.
Beherrschung von Programmiersprachen wie ABAP, Python, SQL oder ähnlichen.
Erfahrung mit SAP EAM (SAP PM) wäre von Vorteil.
Ausgeprägte analytische und problemlösende Fähigkeiten.
Erfahrung in Datenmigrationsprojekten mit SAP, Salesforce oder Unternehmensplattformen wie CRM, SAP oder Microsoft.
Ausgezeichnete Deutsch und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift.
Bereitschaft zu Reisen in ganz Europa.
Unsere Benefits - vielseitig & durchdacht
Freue dich auf Flexibilität: Bei uns kannst du Büroarbeit und Homeoffice flexibel miteinander kombinieren. Du kannst sogar 20 Tage pro Jahr innerhalb Europas im Workation-Modus arbeiten.

Entfalte deine Talente: Wir möchten, dass du mit uns wächst. Ob bei der täglichen Arbeit, im aktiven Austausch mit anderen oder einem individuellen Training - unsere Lernkultur ermöglicht es dir, deine persönliche Entwicklung auf das nächste Level zu bringen.
Vernetze dich: Nutze die Gelegenheit, dich in unseren Digital Empowerment Communities für Zusammenarbeit, Lernen und Netzwerkbildung zu engagieren.

Tanke neue Energie: Bei uns hast du 30 Tage Urlaub pro Jahr plus Heiligabend und Silvester frei. Du willst mehr? Dann tausche einen Teil deines Gehaltes gegen zusätzliche Urlaubstage oder mache ein Sabbatical.
Profitiere von unseren Mobilitätslösungen: Von Auto- und Fahrrad-Leasingangeboten bis hin zu einem subventionierten Deutschland-Ticket - dein Weg ist unser Weg.
Denke voraus: Mit unserer betrieblichen Altersvorsorge und einem guten Versicherungspaket kümmern wir uns um deine Zukunft.
Das ist noch lange nicht alles... Über alle weiteren Benefits sprechen wir gerne mit dir im Recruitingprozess.
Hast Du noch Fragen?
Für weitere Informationen wende Dich bitte an Henrike Veser, henrike.veser@eon.com.

Bitte habe Verständnis dafür, dass wir aus datenschutzrechtlichen Gründen ausschließlich über unser Portal eingereichte Bewerbungen annehmen können. Bewerbungsunterlagen, die uns per E-Mail erreichen, können wir leider nicht berücksichtigen.
