997051,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/997051,Civil Engineer - Mid Level - Renewable Energy Focus (Hybrid),Barr Engineering Co.,,,,,"Job Description:
Summary:

The person in this position will work with project teams on civil engineering and related technical assignments. This position generally aligns with the renewable energy sector and power delivery, with the option of branching into other sectors as needed. Work will include performing and leading tasks related to civil design
column2: assisting engineers and clients with the development of wind and solar projects
column3: preparing construction documents, site evaluations, feasibility studies, road design, grading, stormwater design
column4: preparing technical reports, and completing other tasks. Other duties may include assisting with project management.

column1: Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in civil engineering or a related field
5 years of related experience
Computer skills and familiarity with Microsoft Word as well as intermediate to advanced knowledge of Excel
Experience with AutoCAD, Civil 3D, or other CAD-based civil design software
Experience with GIS-based software
Strong interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills
Ability and willingness to conduct fieldwork independently or with a team, either locally or out of town, when needed
Legal authorization to work in the United States without the need for sponsorship from Barr, now or in the future
Possession of a valid driver's license and acceptable driving record
Professional Engineer (PE) or ability to obtain certification within one year
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with preparation of plans and specifications, analyzing alternatives, and developing quantity takeoffs and cost estimates
Construction administration experience such as review and response to payment applications, submittals, and claims and interpreting plans, specifications, and bid documents
Experience drafting PowerPoint presentations, memos, and report text and figures
7 or more years of related work experience

A hybrid work arrangement may be considered for this position. A hybrid work arrangement refers to splitting time worked between a Barr office and a home office. This position can be based out of Barr's Minneapolis, Minnesota, or Denver, Colorado, offices.
Colorado Applicants Only:
Compensation:

The anticipated base salary range for this position is $70,000-90,000/year. Compensation will vary based upon experience, education, skill level, and other compensable factors. Employees in this position may also be eligible for a discretionary cash bonus. Our compensation comes in more ways than traditional base salary, and we believe that when all those elements are combined, our compensation is a competitive part of the total value proposition of working at Barr.
Benefits:

People report that they stay at Barr because of the camaraderie and career opportunities. Another draw is our competitive package of employee benefits, which includes professional development funding, 401(k) retirement savings plan, employee stock ownership plan (ESOP) participation, medical and dental insurance, life insurance, disability and accidental death insurance, flexible spending accounts for healthcare and dependent care expenses, paid holidays, paid time off, and compensatory time for exempt/salaried staff (time off or pay for extra time worked).

NOTE: Applicants must be able to work in locations that feature rough terrain typical of construction sites and must be able to enter and work in facilities that include limited accessibility, moving machinery, and other conditions typical of industrial facilities. Position will require lifting or moving field-testing equipment. Safety training will be provided before being given work assignments on these sites. Applicants will be asked to participate in a drug screening program at the request of clients.
#LI-Hybrid

Open positions at Barr Engineering Co. do not have application deadlines. 969706,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/969706,Solar/ Electrical Engineer - Renewable Energy,Partner Engineering and Science,,,,,"ABOUT US

PARTNER offers full-service engineering, environmental and energy consulting, and design services throughout the Americas, Europe, and around the globe. As a leading firm in the Commercial Real Estate (CRE) industry, we have 1200+ employees in more than 40 offices. We want to be the best home for talented professionals in our field! We know that if we hire the best and the brightest, the clients will come, and we will continue to build our company. Our internally focused mission has led to Partner being recognized on ENR's Top 500 Design Firms List, Inc. 5000's Fastest-Growing Private Companies in America, and Zweig's Best Firms to Work For. Our entrepreneurial environment is one where each person can have an impact. Check out this role and join our team of talented people!
Learn more about Partner at www.partneresi.com.
SUMMARY

Electrical engineer prepares and/or reviews engineering technical designs and design templates for Partner Engineering and Science's Renewable Energy Team. This role requires an applied understanding of NEC Code, solar, battery storage and other power generation and utility interconnection electrical engineering. The role is for a licensed electrical engineer who will be part of a team reviewing and developing designs by applying engineering principles and current industry data. The Electrical Engineer shall exercise good engineering practices to promote the success of Partner Engineering as a leader in Renewable Energy installations. This position requires minimum 3 days a week presence in office.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Prepare Electrical Engineering technical designs and design templates for renewable energy installations
Provide due diligence efforts and interpretations of designs by others
Prepare the basis of design analysis and review
Interface with other technical disciplines
Prepare engineering design and construction documents
Improve the Electrical Engineering design processes through collaboration
Travel for site inspection, evaluation, and viability analyses
Attend and participate in project-related meetings
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering from an accredited engineering program
5+ years' experience working with, interpreting, designing, and/or preparing Electrical Engineering documents including:
NEC Code
Solar systems
Battery Storage systems
EV Charging systems
Utility interconnection for Distributed Generation (Behind and Front of the Meter), utility scale a plus
Effective problem-solving and evaluation skills
Strong verbal and written communication abilities
Proficient software user including:
AutoCAD
ETAP
MS Excel, MS Word, MS Project
Modeling Software: PVSYST - Helioscope
Other engineering design software
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Must be able to read, write, speak & comprehend English
Must be able to communicate clearly in person and over the telephone
Visual acuity adequate to perform job duties, including reading information from printed sources and computer screen
Requires frequent bending, reaching, standing, walking, sitting, pushing and pulling exerted regularly throughout the work shift
Requires the ability to climb a ladder
COMPENSATION
Salary range: $90,000 to $125,000. This is what we reasonably expect to pay for the role

The pay scale for this role considers a wide range of factors when making compensation decisions including, but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note, the disclosed pay scale estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic location where the position may be filled.
You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary incentive bonus program which is dependent on various factors, including, but not limited to individual and organizational performance.
BENEFITS
Competitive benefits package including health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, vacation and sick time, and a 401(k) plan with a company match.
We will consider qualified applicants who have criminal histories in a manner consistent with the law.
Equal Employment Opportunity

It is Partner Engineering and Science, Inc's (The Company) policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. The Company does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, legally protected medical condition or information including genetic information, family care status, military caregiver status, veteran status, marital status, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal laws.
California Consumer Privacy Act

We collect personal information from you in connection with your application for employment with Partner Engineering and Science, Inc. For details on what personal information we collect and the purposes for which we collect it, please visit:
https://www.partneresi.com/about/careers/california-consumer-privacy-act",,,,,2024-12-01 15:29:28,,

992866,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/992866,Senior Engineer - Power System Studies,"Schweitzer Engineering Laboratories, Inc.",,,,,"Schweitzer Engineering Laboratories (SEL) invites candidates for Senior Project Engineer - Studies position. A successful candidate must have a PhD/master's degree or equivalent experience and exposure into power systems. You should have experience with studies tools like PSSE, DigSILENT, MATLAB, PSCAD or RTDS and, have expertise knowledge in design verification studies like power system optimization, power system dynamic stability studies, and Grid interconnection studies for renewable power plants. Candidates must be comfortable to travel and confident to work on global projects. If you are excited and highly motivated to take this opportunity, then please apply directly!
As a Senior Power System Studies Engineer, a typical day might include the following:
Conducting linear and nonlinear optimization techniques for solving power flow problems.
Conducting steady state and dynamic simulations to analyze the stability.
Assessing the feasibility and impact of connecting new generation sources (e.g., renewable energy) to the existing grid.
Designing HIL setups to test and validate control systems and protection schemes in a simulated environment.
Analyzing test results to identify and resolve potential issues before deployment in the field.
Staying updated with the latest advancements in power system technologies and methodologies.
Ensuring compliance with industry standards, safety regulations, and best practices.
Mentor and develop professional staff.
Model, teach, and apply SEL Values, Principles of Operations, and World Class Manufacturing Principles.
Understand. Create. Simplify.
Other duties as assigned
This job might be for you if:
Can demonstrated a deep understanding of electric power system optimization and control
Can demonstrated knowledge of electric power system steady state and dynamics , Hardware In The Loop (HIL)
Are willing to travel both domestically and internationally a minimum of 25% based on focus area.
Location
Preferably Pullman, WA or Houston, TX
We are open to any SEL location within the United States, provided there is space available
Competitive pay. Superior benefits. Inspiring work.
People are at the core of our company and we hire employee-owners. We welcome you to learn more about how we support employees.
We're 100% employee owned. Retirement benefits include an employer funded stock ownership plan (ESOP) and personal 401K options.
We offer top tier medical, prescription, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance.

We recognize the importance of a healthy life balance and offer: 10 paid holidays, annual vacation accrual starting at 12 days, 9 paid sick days, and paid family and medical leave that covers 90% of your pay.
We foster growth and development of our employees through avenues such as STEM courses, apprenticeships, tuition assistance, and engineering development programs.
Ask our team about other benefits including wellness, fertility, adoption, and flexible spending benefits.
Pay Range Data

We anticipate filling this position as a Senior Engineer $100,900.00 - $168,100.00. We are open to reviewing additional candidates with more or less experience and the pay range may differ if filled at a different level. Our pay ranges are determined by job, responsibility, and location. We base our starting pay offer and title on location and job-related factors such as candidate experience, training, knowledge, and skills.
Communication with Applicants
We communicate with all applicants. If you do not receive a response about your application, please check your SPAM filter or reach out to us at careers@selinc.com.
SEL is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Vets/Disabled.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:29:33,,

column2: they add cybersecurity, automation, and communication. They use cutting-edge technologies and operate at speeds that push other pieces of the grid to go faster. Model, teach, and apply SEL Values, Principles of Operations, and World Class Manufacturing Principles.

You have 2+ years' experience in electric power systems, protection practices, and philosophies.

You have working knowledge of apparatus and protective relay application at an electrical utility or industrial plant.

994885,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/994885,Senior Engineering Project Manager - Renewable Energy,Revamp Engineering,,,,,"Founded in 2016, Revamp is the premier engineering design firm focused on large-scale renewable energy projects. We are committed to doing our part in the energy transition and providing a welcoming workplace for talented people ready to make a real difference fighting climate change. Since 2020, Revamp engineers have designed more than 10% of all solar generation capacity installed in the US.

We are made up of a diverse group of mostly remote, US-based employees spanning from the East Coast all the way to The Aloha State of Hawaii! We are artists, immigrants, singers, dancers, pastry chefs, outdoor enthusiasts, animal lovers, and travelers who embrace innovation and collaboration. For more information, visit our website at www.revamp-eng.com.
Duties & Responsibilities:

• As part of the Developer Services team, you will support clients who are developing some of the largest and most impactful renewable energy projects in the United States, leveraging Revamp's dynamic team of expert renewable engineering consultants.
• Oversee projects in a portfolio or a suite of projects.
• Independently apply extensive and diversified knowledge of principles and practices in engineering consulting and project management.
• Independently evaluate, select, and adapt procedures and criteria.
• Responsible for project scopes, schedules, and budgets.
• Manage both internal and subconsultant deliverables.
• Prepare monthly invoicing.
• Manage multiple complex projects at one time.
• May act as a Portfolio Manager for a suite of similar projects.
• Lead in the preparation of proposals.
• Lead all staff necessary to complete assignments.
• Review and finalize scopes, budgets, and schedules for assignments.
• Prepare proposals to provide professional services for engineering projects or portfolios.
• Plan, schedule, or coordinate the preparation of documents or activities for multiple major projects or is responsible for an entire portfolio.
• Review complete project documents for conformity and quality assurance.
• May act as a supervisor.
• Interact with clients, customers, officials, subcontractors, and others.
• Manage client standards and best practices.
• Represent Revamp in meetings with clients, customers, officials, subcontractors, and others and present specific aspects of engineering assignments.
• Perform essential duties including meeting deliverables and deadlines.
• Perform additional duties as assigned or directed.

993007,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/993007,"Power Systems Engineer, Staff II - NERC",Electric Power Engineers,,,,,"Overview
We are designing the Grid of the future.

Be a part of an innovative team shaping the grid of the future through advanced energy intelligence. Responsibilities
Join us in leading the change!

This position will have specific emphasis placed on conducting remote and onsite testing for wind generation projects, solar generation projects, conventional generation projects, and energy storage projects in accordance with different ISO (ERCOT, PJM, etc.) and NERC requirements.

Ability to perform remote and onsite commissioning and/or compliance testing for conventional and renewable generation projects.
Perform high level bulk power system studies using various power system software such as PSS/e, PSCAD, Aspen, and PSLF.

Conduct engineering studies for new and emerging technologies such as inverters, wind turbines, or Bulk Energy Storage Systems, which may require interaction with equipment vendors to complete the analyses.
Process, generate and maintain data as required.
Take responsibility for the timely completion of projects assigned while meeting all project quality and budget objectives.
Identify training needs and present to the Engineering Manager as needed.
Work to continuously enhance existing procedures and workflows.
Qualifications
Bring your passion, here's what's needed:
Bachelor of Science or higher in Electrical Engineering with power system emphasis. Post-graduate Preferred.
Strong verbal communication: Ability to confidently communicate with clients and other relevant personnel (e.g., SCADA provider, OEM, etc.) while leading testing sessions.
Experience performing one or more of the following studies: Power Flow Studies, Transient Stability Studies, Dynamic Modeling, etc.
Onsite field testing experience preferred.
Familiarity with power plant controller operation, primary frequency response, automatic voltage regulation, and droop control preferred.
Experience with one or more of the following software tools: PSS/e, PSLF, DSATools (PSAT, TSAT, SSAT, VSAT), PSCAD, ETAP, ASPEN.
Perform complex tasks according to good engineering practice and EPE procedures.
Capable of autonomously and independently executing on assigned tasks.
Participate in multifunctional teams to obtain input, address comments and perform studies.
Strong organizational and communication skills, both written and verbal, particularly with respect to explaining technical matters.
Have high standards on producing quality reports and products.
Strong technical/report writing skills.
How we support you:
Comprehensive health and wellness benefits including medical, dental, and vision with 100% premium coverage for you.
Generous PTO and paid holidays
Continuous Education Benefits
Work with industry leaders
401K, up to a 4% match (100% vested from day 1)
Flexible Work including hybrid and remote possibilities based on position.
Location: Remote US or Canada
Travel: Occasional travel may be needed (10% or less)

930636,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/930636,Senior Energy Engineer,Thielsch Engineering,,,,,"Job Details
Job Location

Full Time

Description

The Senior Energy Engineer will be responsible for identifying and verifying energy efficiency opportunities to support energy efficiency initiatives throughout the Northeast. The individual will work under the supervision of the Engineering Manager . The position will be responsible for assembling data through site visits, manufacturer's information, and plans and specifications to scope, validate, and calculate the impact from energy efficiency recommendations identified by themselves or others.

Identifying and inspecting cost effective opportunities for improving the efficiency of electric, natural gas, and deliverable fuel systems and end uses in commercial, industrial, or multifamily buildings.

Developing energy savings analyses, cost estimates, and written reports for the installation of recommended improvements using documented engineering methods and principals and /or existing models and methodologies that are approved and certified in the industry.
Arranging for financing and incentives to help make the improvements more affordable, working with utility-sponsored initiatives in the United States.
***About 50% local travel (MA, NH and RI)
Education and Experience:
Bachelor's degree in mechanical or electrical engineering, with a demonstrated interest in energy efficiency, de-carbonization and building science.
5 - 7 years' experience in the energy efficiency field or experience with energy modeling
Minimum 1 year experience writing technical reports
Strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage workload effectively under general direction.
Working proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, including Outlook, Word, Excel
Excellent oral and written communications skills.
Preferred Education and Experience:
EIT, CEM, or other relevant professional certifications.
Understanding of demand side management and utility-based incentive programs
Work Environment:
Work is performed indoors and outdoors.
Compensation & Benefits:
Competitive wages
Health Care - United HealthCare, Delta Dental and Vision Service Plan

Employer-paid Employee Stock Ownership Program (ESOP)

The RISE Group is an employee-owned, professional engineering firm that provides a complete range of consulting, design, and energy services to customers throughout the United States and internationally. Our work demonstrates how creative collaboration can produce outstanding results for our clients and our communities.
Our Culture

At RISE, our customers come from all walks of life -- and so do our employees! 927369,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/927369,Mining Engineer - Senior Level (Hybrid),Barr Engineering Co.,,,,,"Job Description:
Summary:

The person in this position will provide mining engineering and related technical expertise to Barr's multidisciplinary project teams. Work may include assisting mining clients with implementation and development sequencing, ore blending, overall mine technical reports (pre-feasibility and feasibility), whittle optimization, development and operations scheduling, economic analysis, and report writing.

Other responsibilities such as business development or relationship development, project management, project planning and scheduling may also be a part of this strategic role. This person will serve as a mentor to junior and mid-level engineers, helping them develop their technical and project management skills by reviewing technical reports, providing guidance on analyses, and overseeing their financial and client management on projects. Preferred Qualifications:
20 years of related experience
Mine operations and/or development and planning experience
Professional Engineering (PE) or Qualified Person (QP) certification or ability to obtain within one year
Established network with mining and development clients and the ability to develop or foster ongoing relationships and maintain a high level of client service

A hybrid work arrangement may be considered for this position. A hybrid work arrangement refers to splitting time worked between a Barr office and a home office. This position can be based out of Barr's Salt Lake City, Utah

931508,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/931508,Entry Level Directed Energy Engineer,SURVICE Engineering Company,,,,,"Join Us in Making a Difference in the Lives of Those Defending Our Nation!
Why SURVICE?

Come join the SURVICE Engineering mission to protect, enhance, and enable those who defend the United States. Since 1981, we have supported the DoD community, as well as Homeland Security, advanced technologies, environmental, and commercial markets. Our employees have backgrounds in engineering, physics, mathematics, chemistry, computer science, acquisition, technical writing, training, and other technical and administrative fields. And many of our personnel have DoD and/or operational military experience. If you're looking for a challenging and rewarding career with a leading organization, come see what we can offer you!
Position
Entry Level Directed Energy Engineer
Location: Dayton, Ohio
Security Clearance: Active Clearance or Eligible to Obtain - U.S. citizenship required
Salary: $75,000 - $90,000 Depending on Experience and Education
Travel: 5%

Benefits: SURVICE Engineering offers a total rewards package to include competitive salaries, comprehensive insurance options, paid time off, 401(k) with company match, flexible spending, tuition reimbursement.
Position Summary

SURVICE Engineering is currently seeking an Entry Level Directed Energy Engineer to support several DoD programs. The successful candidate will be working within a dynamic multi-disciplinary team to solve challenging problems for the defense community, supporting multiple customers including the Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL) and other DoD customers. The primary focus of this work will involve laser directed energy systems, but High-Power Microwave (HPM) may be involved as well.
Primary Duties and Responsibilities
Conducting directed energy research, development, test and evaluation by developing test plans, conducting laboratory or on-range testing, and conducting post-test analysis.
Conducting directed energy analysis in conjunction with DoD partners to evaluate and characterize relevant threats to aerial and other military systems.
Performing directed energy modeling and simulation studies at various levels of fidelity to include engineering-level analysis, operational analysis, and mission-/campaign-level analysis.
Translating engineering-level survivability outputs into inputs to support mission, campaign, and analytical wargaming.
Minimum Qualifications of Entry Level Directed Energy Engineer

Bachelor's or Master's Degree in a technical field of study including Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related STEM major and 0-3 years of relevant experience. Qualified candidates in their final year of an accredited STEM Bachelor's program will be considered. Transitioning military with prior experience are encouraged to apply. Candidates are not required or expected to possess all qualifications
column2: if you possess some of the desired qualifications, you are encouraged to apply.

column1: Strong communication and writing skills
Experience with experimental research, data analysis, design, or related activities
Experience with using and interpreting results from established numerical modeling tools
Experience or interest in military aircraft, weapon systems, operations, and procedures.

Practical knowledge or experience with modeling and simulation environments.
Strong analytical, inference, critical thinking, and creative problem-solving skills.

About Us

SURVICE Engineering is a nationally recognized, single-source engineering service provider for Government and Industry organizations involved in all phases of the systems engineering process. Our employees are our most valuable asset, and they are proud to have supported the development, testing, analysis, and modeling and simulation (M&S) of many of the major U.S. air, land, and sea combat systems in the field today. They have also contributed their expertise to other vital national defense programs and technologies that involve survivability, cybersecurity, information technology/management, software engineering, unmanned aerial systems (UASs), and metrology/reverse engineering.

999597,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/999597,Power Systems Engineer Staff III,Electric Power Engineers,,,,,"Overview
We are designing the grid of the future!

Be a part of an innovative team shaping the grid of the future through advanced energy intelligence. For more than half a century, Electric Power Engineers, (EPE) has partnered with power and energy clients across the globe providing consulting expertise and energy intelligence software solutions for complex engineering and grid modeling challenges. As leaders in the renewables space, we are focused on building a modern, secure, and resilient gid. Join us in making an impact on the communities we serve and the environment in which we live. Together we can transform the future of energy.
Responsibilities
Join us in leading the change!
We are looking to hire Power Systems Engineer to be part of our Team.
How you can make an impact:

Work on interconnection projects, including modeling, due diligence, interconnection analysis including evaluating available capacity for transmission lines and substations and estimate timing and costs.
Create and validate PSS/E, PSCAD, ETAP, and ASPEN models for renewable generation: Solar PV, BESS, and Wind.

Perform tasks requiring the application of standard electrical engineering techniques and procedures. Work includes analysis of electrical transmission/distribution systems, including generation interconnection studies, load flow analysis, dynamic studies, reactive power compensation study, transient stability analysis, short circuit, protection coordination and voltage analysis.
Stay up to date on relevant state and federal regulatory matters, NERC, FERC compliance, and ISOs new requirements.
Work with the team to support EPE's generation developer Clients with understanding the interconnection process in different Independent System Operators (ISO).
Design and review Preliminary Site Layout, Single Line Diagrams, and 30% Design Package in AutoCAD.
Perform Generation Interconnection Applications in ISOs as needed.
Qualifications
Bring your passion, here's what's needed:
2+ years minimum experience in generation interconnection and compliance related activities
Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering preferred.
Expert knowledge of generation interconnection process in different ISOs, especially in ERCOT.
In-depth knowledge of power system fundamentals, software in power systems and emerging energy technology trends
Demonstrated expertise in detailed understanding of the analytical tools/software used in the industry.
Strong customer focus, both internal and external.
Demonstrate attention to details and being comfortable to be outside of the comfort zone.
Proactive in learning new technology and engineering knowledge.
How we support you:
Comprehensive health and wellness benefits including medical, dental, and vision with 100% premium coverage for you.
Generous PTO and paid holidays
Continuous Education Benefits
Work with industry leaders
401K, up to a 4% match (100% vested from day 1)
Flexible Work including hybrid and remote possibilities based on position.
Travel: Occasional travel may be needed (10% or less)
EPE is an equal opportunity/AA/Disability/Veteran employer. The EEO is the Law poster, and its supplement are available using the following links: EEOC is the Law Poster
If you are interested in applying for employment with EPE and need special assistance to apply for a posted position, please send an email to: applicationassistance@epeconsulting.com
Third-Party Recruiting Notification

EPE does not accept unsolicited resumes from third-party recruiters. Any unsolicited third-party resumes forwarded by recruiters to EPE via our career page or to any of our managers or employees will be considered public information, may be treated as a direct application from the person identified in the resume, and will not be eligible for placement fee payment to the agency. EPE will not pay a fee to a third-party recruiter or agency without a previously signed third-party agreement and has not coordinated their recruiting activity with the appropriate member of the Talent Acquisition team.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:31:19,,
968582,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/968582,PV Solar Engineer,"E2 Consulting Engineers, Inc.",,,,,"About the Organization

E2 Consulting Engineers, Inc. (E2) is a professional services firm established in 1988 specializing in a full spectrum of engineering services including, project engineering and design, federal base operations and infrastructure support services, gas pipeline construction and inspection services, environmental consulting and remediation, and information technology services. At E2, we value safety, innovation and collaboration, and we are dedicated to excellence.
Overview

This role is pivotal in overseeing the deliverables for PV Solar projects, guiding clients from the initial concept, through siting and permitting, to the comprehensive delivery of turnkey designs, construction, and startup phases. Our Renewable Energy team specializes in power generation and storage for both utility-scale and commercial/industrial sectors, offering extensive experience in design and project management. Our services span from initial PV Solar design and reviews to detailed site inspections and follow-up reports. Our project scope ranges from 0.5MW to 300MW, with interconnection voltages from 480V to 500kV, encompassing both standalone storage and hybrid systems combining storage with other renewables like wind and solar. This position reports directly to the Senior Renewables Engineering Manager, ensuring a significant role in advancing renewable energy initiatives.
This opportunity requires up to 50% travel in USA
Responsibilities

Conduct energy production model reviews and technical due diligence: Evaluate the accuracy and reliability of energy production models, ensuring they meet technical standards and project requirements. This includes:
Design and Engineering Reviews: Analyze PV system designs for optimal performance and compliance with engineering principles and safety standards.
Technology Reviews: Assess the suitability and reliability of solar technologies used in projects.
Energy Model Review: Examine energy production estimates for accuracy and realistic assumptions.
Financial Model Review: Evaluate the financial projections of PV projects to ensure they are based on sound energy production estimates.
Risk Assessment: Identify potential risks in PV projects, including technical, financial, and environmental factors.

Perform site inspections including testing (IV tracing, thermal imaging, insulation resistance...): Carry out comprehensive site inspections to verify the physical condition and proper functioning of PV installations. This includes performing various tests such as IV (current voltage) tracing to assess the performance of solar panels, thermal imaging to detect overheating issues, and insulation resistance tests to ensure electrical safety.

Overall project management: Oversee the planning, execution, and completion of PV projects, coordinating between different stakeholders, managing timelines, and ensuring projects meet quality standards and regulatory compliance.

Periodic Sales support: Provide technical expertise and support to the sales team, assisting in the preparation of presentations, answering technical queries from potential clients, and contributing to the development of sales strategies.

Scopes and proposals drafting: Draft detailed project scopes and proposals, outlining the objectives, methodologies, timelines, and budgets for PV projects. This involves understanding client requirements and designing tailored solutions to meet their energy needs.

Produce energy models in HelioScope and PVsyst: Develop accurate solar energy simulations using HelioScope and PVsyst software to predict the performance and output of photovoltaic (PV) systems. This involves selecting appropriate system components, configuration, and environmental conditions to create reliable energy production estimates.
Qualifications
Required
Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering or similar field.
Minimum of three (3) or more years of experience working renewable energy projects
Proficient using Microsoft Office suite (e.g., Excel, Word, and Outlook).
Strong analytical, problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Bilingual (Spanish and English)
Preferred
Professional Engineer's License in Electrical Engineering preferred but not required.
Direct experience designing PV Solar Energy & Storage projects.
Master's degree
Previous consulting engineering experience preferred.
Proficient using Helioscope, Aurora or PVSyst.
Proficient using AutoCAD.
Proficient using SolarGrade.
PMI certified.
NABCEP certified.
OSHA certified.
Industry relevant trainings & certification
Passport holder
Benefits
E2 offers an excellent benefits package including health, dental, vision, and life insurance, 401(k) with employer match, paid time off.
Wage Data Per State Requirements
Salary range for this position is $100,000- $150,000. The starting salary will be commensurate with skill, education, experience, and working environment.
Work Environment/Physical Demands
Work Environment
This job operates in a professional office environment and uses standard office equipment such as computers and phones.
Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Ability to sit/ stand for up to 8 hours per day.
Ability to move freely for up to 8 hours per day.
Drug Free Workplace

E2 Consulting Engineers, Inc. is a Drug Free Workplace. After accepting an offer of employment, applicants may be required to undergo background checks, drug testing, and/or fit-for-duty physical examination. Drug screens will include, but not be limited to, Amphetamines, Cocaine Metabolites, Marijuana Metabolites (THC), Opiates, and Phencyclidine (PCP). As a federal contractor, E2 cannot permit employees in certain positions to use medical marijuana, even if prescribed by an authorized physician.
Solicitation
Please no solicitation of any kind from agencies, staffing, or recruiting firms.
EEO Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:31:24,,

969707,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/969707,Solar/ Electrical Engineer - Renewable Energy,Partner Engineering and Science,,,,,"ABOUT US

PARTNER offers full-service engineering, environmental and energy consulting, and design services throughout the Americas, Europe, and around the globe. As a leading firm in the Commercial Real Estate (CRE) industry, we have 1200+ employees in more than 40 offices. We want to be the best home for talented professionals in our field! We know that if we hire the best and the brightest, the clients will come, and we will continue to build our company. Our internally focused mission has led to Partner being recognized on ENR's Top 500 Design Firms List, Inc. 5000's Fastest-Growing Private Companies in America, and Zweig's Best Firms to Work For. Our entrepreneurial environment is one where each person can have an impact. Check out this role and join our team of talented people!
Learn more about Partner at www.partneresi.com.
SUMMARY

Electrical engineer prepares and/or reviews engineering technical designs and design templates for Partner Engineering and Science's Renewable Energy Team. This role requires an applied understanding of NEC Code, solar, battery storage and other power generation and utility interconnection electrical engineering. The role is for a licensed electrical engineer who will be part of a team reviewing and developing designs by applying engineering principles and current industry data. The Electrical Engineer shall exercise good engineering practices to promote the success of Partner Engineering as a leader in Renewable Energy installations. This position requires minimum 3 days a week presence in office.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Prepare Electrical Engineering technical designs and design templates for renewable energy installations
Provide due diligence efforts and interpretations of designs by others
Prepare the basis of design analysis and review
Interface with other technical disciplines
Prepare engineering design and construction documents
Improve the Electrical Engineering design processes through collaboration
Travel for site inspection, evaluation, and viability analyses
Attend and participate in project-related meetings
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering from an accredited engineering program
5+ years' experience working with, interpreting, designing, and/or preparing Electrical Engineering documents including:
NEC Code
Solar systems
Battery Storage systems
EV Charging systems
Utility interconnection for Distributed Generation (Behind and Front of the Meter), utility scale a plus
Effective problem-solving and evaluation skills
Strong verbal and written communication abilities
Proficient software user including:
AutoCAD
ETAP
MS Excel, MS Word, MS Project
Modeling Software: PVSYST - Helioscope
Other engineering design software
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Must be able to read, write, speak & comprehend English
Must be able to communicate clearly in person and over the telephone
Visual acuity adequate to perform job duties, including reading information from printed sources and computer screen
Requires frequent bending, reaching, standing, walking, sitting, pushing and pulling exerted regularly throughout the work shift
Requires the ability to climb a ladder
COMPENSATION
Salary range: $90,000 to $125,000. This is what we reasonably expect to pay for the role

The pay scale for this role considers a wide range of factors when making compensation decisions including, but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. Please note, the disclosed pay scale estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic location where the position may be filled.
You may also be eligible to participate in a discretionary incentive bonus program which is dependent on various factors, including, but not limited to individual and organizational performance.
BENEFITS
Competitive benefits package including health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, vacation and sick time, and a 401(k) plan with a company match.
We will consider qualified applicants who have criminal histories in a manner consistent with the law.
Equal Employment Opportunity

It is Partner Engineering and Science, Inc's (The Company) policy to provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. The Company does not unlawfully discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, legally protected medical condition or information including genetic information, family care status, military caregiver status, veteran status, marital status, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal laws.
California Consumer Privacy Act

We collect personal information from you in connection with your application for employment with Partner Engineering and Science, Inc. For details on what personal information we collect and the purposes for which we collect it, please visit:
https://www.partneresi.com/about/careers/california-consumer-privacy-act",,,,,2024-12-01 15:31:32,,

1003756,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/1003756,Senior Power Systems Engineer,Electric Power Engineers,,,,,"Overview
We are designing the Grid of the future

Be a part of an innovative team shaping the grid of the future through advanced energy intelligence. For more than half a century, Electric Power Engineers, (EPE) has partnered with power and energy clients across the globe providing consulting expertise and energy intelligence software solutions for complex engineering and grid modeling challenges. As leaders in the renewables space, we are focused on building a modern, secure, and resilient gid. Join us in making an impact on the communities we serve and the environment in which we live. Together we can transform the future of energy.
Responsibilities
Join us in leading the change!

EPE is looking to recruit a Senior Engineer with a background in Interconnection or Transmission Planning studies preferably in the MISO, SPP or SERC regions. In this role you will work closely with senior leadership to support our growth strategy and provide subject matter expertise both internally through coaching and developing staff as well as externally to our clients.
How you can make an impact:

Perform complex interconnection studies including loadflow, short circuit and transient stability across multiple ISOs and Utilities in the Eastern Interconnect & ERCOT. Ideally focusing on SERC, ERCOT MISO or SPP
Review ISO and/or Utility interconnection study results, replicate findings and identify errors or alternative mitigations that could impact assigned network upgrades.
Support generation, large load and merchant transmission developers navigate interconnection processes across the Eastern Interconnect.
Collaborate with other team members on interconnection related studies and stay up to date with industry trends and regulatory changes.
Passionate about solving difficult technical problems, providing innovative solutions and taking ownership of the solutions provided.
Support the development of new products and services
Qualifications
Bring your passion, here what's needed:
Minimum 4 years of experience in the electric energy industry.
Experience in IBR modelling, transmission planning and/or interconnection studies.
Strong understanding of FERC, NERC and ISO interconnection requirements and standards.
In-depth knowledge of at least one but preferably several of the following software packages: PSSE, TARA, PSLF, PowerWorld. ASPEN and PSCAD
Beneficial Experience
Direct experience working at an ISO/Utility or on behalf of these entities as a consultant.
Experience with large-load interconnection studies
Experience with DER interconnection or studies
Experience with production cost modelling
Automation experience (Python, C#, SQL)
How we support you:
Comprehensive health and wellness benefits including medical, dental, and vision with 100% premium coverage for you.
Generous PTO and paid holidays
Work with industry leaders
401K, up to a 4% match (100% vested from day 1)
Flexible Work including hybrid and remote possibilities base on position.
Location: This position will pen to Remote
Travel: Occasional travel may be needed (10% or less)

1002324,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1002324,Power Engineer,"Schweitzer Engineering Laboratories, Inc.",,,,,"The devices we make at SEL are embedded in the power grid. They prevent blackouts. They make outages safer and shorter in duration
column2: they add cybersecurity, automation, and communication. They use cutting-edge technologies and operate at speeds that push other pieces of the grid to go faster. As a Power Engineer in Research and Development, you'll provide solutions and services that help our customers protect and control critical electrical infrastructure and power systems worldwide.

column1: As a Power Engineer, a typical day might include the following:
Maintain a detailed understanding of electric power systems and how to protect, monitor, and control the power system.
Assist in innovating power system protection solutions by developing algorithms to protect, control and monitor power system apparatus such as generators, motors, transformers, feeders etc.
Assist in developing simulation models of power system in Matlab, ATPDraw, RTDS etc. to validate and test the developed algorithms.
Assist in developing product specifications, develop and analyze functional tests.
Assist with application literature, instruction manuals, and data sheets.
Provide power engineering support for customer applications and Field Application Engineers.
Author technical papers to present at technical meetings and conferences.
Model, teach, and apply SEL Values, Principles of Operations, and World Class Manufacturing Principles.
This job might be for you if:
You have a B.S. in Electrical Engineering or equivalent experience.
You have 2+ years' experience in electric power systems, protection practices, and philosophies.
You have experience working in industrial and distribution power systems, and the ability to communicate those experiences.
You have working knowledge of apparatus and protective relay application at an electrical utility or industrial plant.
Location
King of Prussia, PA

This position is located in King of Prussia, PA. Located just twenty miles from Philadelphia, its close proximity allows residents to enjoy all that the big city has to offer. Enjoy easy access to trails along the river, or attend sporting events nearby. The diverse options make King of Prussia the perfect place to call home.
Competitive pay. Superior benefits. Inspiring work.
People are at the core of our company and we hire employee-owners. We welcome you to learn more about how we support employees.
We're 100% employee owned. Retirement benefits include an employer funded stock ownership plan (ESOP) and personal 401K options.
We offer top tier medical, prescription, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance.

We recognize the importance of a healthy life balance and offer: 10 paid holidays, annual vacation accrual starting at 12 days, 9 paid sick days, and paid family and medical leave that covers 90% of your pay.
We foster growth and development of our employees through avenues such as STEM courses, apprenticeships, tuition assistance, and engineering development programs.
Ask our team about other benefits including wellness, fertility, adoption, and flexible spending benefits.

Salary Range Data: We anticipate filling this position as a Power Engineer $76,100 - 118,900. We are open to reviewing additional candidates with more or less experience and the salary range may differ if filled at a different level. 928194,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/technicians-or-service-jobs/928194,Senior Electrical Project Engineer - Power Systems,"Affiliated Engineers, Inc.",,,,,"Overview

Affiliated Engineers, Inc. (AEI) is a leading, multidisciplinary consulting engineering firm and collaborative community of over 800 employees who plan, design, and deliver high-performance, innovative, and holistic engineering solutions - positively impacting society and advancing humankind.

Recognized in the Top 20 Engineering Firms and Top 3 Science and Technology Firms since 2000 by Building Design + Construction Magazine, AEI is dedicated to enhancing public health and improving patient outcomes, advancing revolutionary biomedical research, and enabling the next generation of scientific discovery and technological innovation through remarkable design and award-winning projects.

From collaborating with the California Air Resources Board to transform air quality in the world's largest, zero net energy emissions testing facility to creating human-centric, technically advanced clinical environments that elevate communities - such as Healthcare Design Magazine's 2022 Design Showcase Winner, Sarasota Memorial Hospital in Venice, Florida - our work reflects the highest standards in sustainable design practices.

As a Senior Electrical Project Engineer - Power Systems in our Denver office, you will help us empower our clients to achieve energy-efficient building solutions, save global environments, and create a better, greener future for all.
Here's why we need you:

In this role, you will build and maintains relationships with clients and project partners, and will be responsible for the overall power systems design process on assigned project . AEI projects may require experience in some or all of the following expertise: substation design, utility coordination, relaying and protection, switchgear automation, dynamic load analysis, SCADA design, Vdc distribution, DER and renewable energy generation, battery energy storage systems, microgrids, and campus distribution for medium and high voltage. You will develop innovative and unique design solutions to align with project, client and project partner needs and leads the team in implementing solutions in the power, mission critical, manufacturing, automotive, higher ed, pharmaceutical, federal, and institutional markets.
Expertise of our most successful Senior Electrical Project Engineer:
BSEE from an ABET accredited program.
Professional engineering registration required. Ability to obtain licensure in various states as needed.
10+ years of experience designing MV or HV power distribution, and/or generation, and/or transmission systems.
Proficiency in computer operation for power engineering design programs (power systems modeling, SCCAF).
Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.

Ability to work well in a team environment, including carrying out appropriate follow-through with others, mentoring, delegating work, and giving and receiving constructive feedback. Communicates well with clients, project partners and with individuals at all levels in the organization.
Effective skills to help you flourish:
Experience in medium and/or high voltage substation design.
Expertise in relaying, protection, and metering design incorporating microprocessor-based devices. Familiarity with programming and testing practices in support of start-up and acceptance testing.
Expertise in switchgear/substation automation sequence of operations.
Expertise in facilitating SCADA implementation.
Experience coordinating with Utility Companies for point of demarcation, interconnect agreements, design standards compliance, etc
Distributed Energy Resources (DER) and renewable energy generation.
Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS) technology.
Grid scale Photovoltaic (PV) technology.
Our dedication to you:
AEI passionately invests in our brilliant talent by allowing for personal and professional growth through supporting clients like NASA
column2: the National Institutes of Health and Cone Health System
column3: the US Department of Homeland Security and US Department of Energy
column4: and Stanford University and the California Institute of Technology.

column1: Our flexible and collaborative work environment demonstrates our dedication to employee appreciation and collective commitment to excellence.

We provide the opportunity to serve the greater good of humanity through work on cutting-edge, state-of-the-art projects like Promega Corporation's Kornberg Center, The University of Arizona's Biomedical Sciences Partnership Building, AbbVie's West Coast Oncology Hub, and BioMed Realty's Gateway of Pacific.

Our culture encourages professional development while adhering to a set of core values that drive company and team decisions. Our commitment to these values - innovation and expertise, integrity, communication, quality, responsibility, opportunity, and growth - informs both project decisions and behavior amongst colleagues and clients
An exceptional benefits package (health, dental, vision) and a year-end bonus based on company profits, individual responsibility, and performance.
Estimated Starting Salary Range: $90,000.00 to $150,000.00
We provide the tools and a support system to ensure a thriving career. If this environment and opportunity to work on world-changing projects align with your goals, we would be thrilled to meet you.
Come and collaborate with us!
To be considered, apply online at https://aeieng.com/about/careers/.
If you know other candidates that would excel at this position, please share this posting with them directly via email, or to your
network on LinkedIn.
AEI is proud to be an EEO/AA Employer/Vet/Disabled.

927711,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/technicians-or-service-jobs/927711,Electrical/Solar Design Engineer- Utility Scale,Pure Power Engineering,,,,,"Pure Power is seeking an engineer to design and generate construction documents for utility scale solar PV systems of 50MW or higher. Pure Power is an engineering firm specializing in designing big, challenging, and high-profile Solar PV systems (with or without energy storage). This is an exciting opportunity for someone with a passion for renewable energy to join a growing practice in our well-respected company.
About Pure Power

Pure Power is an engineering firm specializing in designing big, challenging, and high-profile Solar PV systems. As a full-service engineering firm, we create the electrical and structural drawings and calculation packages for bidding, permits and construction, as well as supporting the lead up to the full engineering drawings, primarily interconnection support and electrical/structural feasibility studies.
Those that join the company have an opportunity to:
Work in a fast growing, exciting, & innovative industry
Have a career with purpose and impact on the environment
Contribute to the best and largest firm in the solar industry with a great reputation built over the past 10 years
Take pride in the fact that our services really are the best in the industry. There is no ""fake it until you make it"" here
Responsibilities
Design and engineer commercial PV solar or BESS systems size at 50MW or higher. This includes detailed design of the associated electrical power systems:
System layout (equipment and modules)
Selection of major equipment and development of equipment specifications.
One-line diagrams
Three-line diagrams
MVAC and DC cable sizing & routing
SCADA & communication design
Grounding design
Wiring diagrams
Trench design
Prepare construction drawings using AutoCAD.
Coordinate activities between clients, utilities, permit agencies, contractors, and other engineering firms.
Participate in the Construction Administration phase of projects by responding to RFIs, reviewing submittals and performing site visits as needed.
Ability to manage time efficiently across multiple projects
Ability to reduce complexity of projects/tasks within their team to increase efficiency.
Ensure compliance with company, industry, trade, and jurisdictional safety standards, practices, and codes
Other tasks as assigned.
Requirements
Required Qualifications
Bachelors in electrical engineering or other related discipline.
3+ years' experience designing commercial and/or utility scale solar PV systems.
Ability to communicate among construction, technical and non-technical personnel, both internally and outside the company.
3+ years' experience working with AutoCAD with an understanding of layer control, dimensioning and scaling, sheet sets, blocks, xrefs, line weights, plot files, and file transmission.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office including Excel, Word, and additional computer software.
Possesses effective written and oral communications skills.
Must possess strong technical verbal and technical writing skills and be able to read technical literature and engineering plans.
Must demonstrate two-way communication to effectively work with internal staff and external clients.
Understanding of the National Electrical Code (NEC).
Preferred Qualifications
Professional Engineering (PE) license.
6+ years' experience designing commercial & utility scale solar PV systems.
Experience designing energy storage systems.
Familiarity with PVsyst, CYMCAP & Etap software.
NABCEP certification
Location

This position will be based out of our exciting Kansas City, KS area office with the flexibility to work a hybrid in-office and remotely weekly schedule. We also provide a parking spot for the days when an employee wishes to drive to the office and for those that utilize public transportation, we will cover the costs associated with traveling to and from the office.
Salary Range
Compensation and Benefits
We offer a competitive salary commensurate with experience. We pay 100% of our employee benefits costs and offer healthcare plans, dental, vision and 401K matching.
Equal Opportunity Employer

Pure Power is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE) that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, organ donation, or length of hair. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.
968582,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/968582,PV Solar Engineer,"E2 Consulting Engineers, Inc.",,,,,"About the Organization

E2 Consulting Engineers, Inc. (E2) is a professional services firm established in 1988 specializing in a full spectrum of engineering services including, project engineering and design, federal base operations and infrastructure support services, gas pipeline construction and inspection services, environmental consulting and remediation, and information technology services. At E2, we value safety, innovation and collaboration, and we are dedicated to excellence.
Overview

This role is pivotal in overseeing the deliverables for PV Solar projects, guiding clients from the initial concept, through siting and permitting, to the comprehensive delivery of turnkey designs, construction, and startup phases. Our Renewable Energy team specializes in power generation and storage for both utility-scale and commercial/industrial sectors, offering extensive experience in design and project management. Our services span from initial PV Solar design and reviews to detailed site inspections and follow-up reports. Our project scope ranges from 0.5MW to 300MW, with interconnection voltages from 480V to 500kV, encompassing both standalone storage and hybrid systems combining storage with other renewables like wind and solar. This position reports directly to the Senior Renewables Engineering Manager, ensuring a significant role in advancing renewable energy initiatives.
This opportunity requires up to 50% travel in USA
Responsibilities

Conduct energy production model reviews and technical due diligence: Evaluate the accuracy and reliability of energy production models, ensuring they meet technical standards and project requirements. This includes:
Design and Engineering Reviews: Analyze PV system designs for optimal performance and compliance with engineering principles and safety standards.
Technology Reviews: Assess the suitability and reliability of solar technologies used in projects.
Energy Model Review: Examine energy production estimates for accuracy and realistic assumptions.
Financial Model Review: Evaluate the financial projections of PV projects to ensure they are based on sound energy production estimates.
Risk Assessment: Identify potential risks in PV projects, including technical, financial, and environmental factors.

Perform site inspections including testing (IV tracing, thermal imaging, insulation resistance...): Carry out comprehensive site inspections to verify the physical condition and proper functioning of PV installations. This includes performing various tests such as IV (current voltage) tracing to assess the performance of solar panels, thermal imaging to detect overheating issues, and insulation resistance tests to ensure electrical safety.

Overall project management: Oversee the planning, execution, and completion of PV projects, coordinating between different stakeholders, managing timelines, and ensuring projects meet quality standards and regulatory compliance.

Periodic Sales support: Provide technical expertise and support to the sales team, assisting in the preparation of presentations, answering technical queries from potential clients, and contributing to the development of sales strategies.

Scopes and proposals drafting: Draft detailed project scopes and proposals, outlining the objectives, methodologies, timelines, and budgets for PV projects. This involves understanding client requirements and designing tailored solutions to meet their energy needs.

Produce energy models in HelioScope and PVsyst: Develop accurate solar energy simulations using HelioScope and PVsyst software to predict the performance and output of photovoltaic (PV) systems. This involves selecting appropriate system components, configuration, and environmental conditions to create reliable energy production estimates.
Qualifications
Required
Bachelor of Science in Electrical Engineering or similar field.
Minimum of three (3) or more years of experience working renewable energy projects
Proficient using Microsoft Office suite (e.g., Excel, Word, and Outlook).
Strong analytical, problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Bilingual (Spanish and English)
Preferred
Professional Engineer's License in Electrical Engineering preferred but not required.
Direct experience designing PV Solar Energy & Storage projects.
Master's degree
Previous consulting engineering experience preferred.
Proficient using Helioscope, Aurora or PVSyst.
Proficient using AutoCAD.
Proficient using SolarGrade.
PMI certified.
NABCEP certified.
OSHA certified.
Industry relevant trainings & certification
Passport holder
Benefits
E2 offers an excellent benefits package including health, dental, vision, and life insurance, 401(k) with employer match, paid time off.
Wage Data Per State Requirements
Salary range for this position is $100,000- $150,000. The starting salary will be commensurate with skill, education, experience, and working environment.
Work Environment/Physical Demands
Work Environment
This job operates in a professional office environment and uses standard office equipment such as computers and phones.
Physical Demands

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Ability to sit/ stand for up to 8 hours per day.
Ability to move freely for up to 8 hours per day.
Drug Free Workplace

E2 Consulting Engineers, Inc. is a Drug Free Workplace. After accepting an offer of employment, applicants may be required to undergo background checks, drug testing, and/or fit-for-duty physical examination. Drug screens will include, but not be limited to, Amphetamines, Cocaine Metabolites, Marijuana Metabolites (THC), Opiates, and Phencyclidine (PCP). As a federal contractor, E2 cannot permit employees in certain positions to use medical marijuana, even if prescribed by an authorized physician.
Solicitation
Please no solicitation of any kind from agencies, staffing, or recruiting firms.
EEO Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.",,,,,2024-12-01 15:32:25,,

969707,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/969707,Solar/ Electrical Engineer - Renewable Energy,Partner Engineering and Science,,,,,"ABOUT US

PARTNER offers full-service engineering, environmental and energy consulting, and design services throughout the Americas, Europe, and around the globe. As a leading firm in the Commercial Real Estate (CRE) industry, we have 1200+ employees in more than 40 offices. We want to be the best home for talented professionals in our field! We know that if we hire the best and the brightest, the clients will come, and we will continue to build our company. Our internally focused mission has led to Partner being recognized on ENR's Top 500 Design Firms List, Inc. 5000's Fastest-Growing Private Companies in America, and Zweig's Best Firms to Work For. Our entrepreneurial environment is one where each person can have an impact. Check out this role and join our team of talented people!
Learn more about Partner at www.partneresi.com.
SUMMARY

Electrical engineer prepares and/or reviews engineering technical designs and design templates for Partner Engineering and Science's Renewable Energy Team. This role requires an applied understanding of NEC Code, solar, battery storage and other power generation and utility interconnection electrical engineering. The role is for a licensed electrical engineer who will be part of a team reviewing and developing designs by applying engineering principles and current industry data. The Electrical Engineer shall exercise good engineering practices to promote the success of Partner Engineering as a leader in Renewable Energy installations. This position requires minimum 3 days a week presence in office.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Prepare Electrical Engineering technical designs and design templates for renewable energy installations
Provide due diligence efforts and interpretations of designs by others
Prepare the basis of design analysis and review
Interface with other technical disciplines
Prepare engineering design and construction documents
Improve the Electrical Engineering design processes through collaboration
Travel for site inspection, evaluation, and viability analyses
Attend and participate in project-related meetings
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering from an accredited engineering program
5+ years' experience working with, interpreting, designing, and/or preparing Electrical Engineering documents including:
NEC Code
Solar systems
Battery Storage systems

994857,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/994857,Power Engineering Intern,Professional Engineering Consultants,,,,,"PEC is currently looking for Electrical Engineering students, who want to have an internship with our company.
We have internships available in the following PEC offices - Wichita, KS, Kansas City, MO, Lawrence, KS, Ft. Collins, CO, Tulsa, OK and Oklahoma City, OK.

Our culture is client focused, so our number one priority is serving them. Within that goal is plenty of room for staff to become engaged in our communities, their cultures, and the industries we serve. We want our employees to have diverse ideas, great communication skills and a passion for both where they work and where they live.
Responsibilities:

993924,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/other-jobs/993924,Sales Engineer - Power Systems,"Schweitzer Engineering Laboratories, Inc.",,,,,"The devices we make at SEL are embedded in the power grid, playing a crucial role in preventing blackouts. They make outages safer and shorter in duration
column2: they add cybersecurity, automation, and communication. They use cutting-edge technologies and operate at speeds that push other pieces of the grid to go faster. SEL products and solutions are critical for the safe, reliable operation of power systems around the world, so our products are built with the highest-quality components in SEL facilities by SEL employees.

column1: As a Sales Engineer in Sales and Customer Service, you will be responsible for developing strong customer partnerships and delivering innovative products and turnkey solutions across Central America and Caribbean countries.
Please note: Applicants must be a US citizen or green card holder, and bilingual in English & Spanish.
As a Sales Engineer, a typical day might include the following:
Manage and develop relationships with SEL customers in the utility and industrial sectors.
Understand the true requirements and objectives of customers. Determine, communicate and deliver the optimal SEL solution that best meets their needs.
Building and maintaining knowledge of all SEL products and teaching customers SEL technology and innovation.
Read and interpret project specifications and technical drawings.
Understand terms and conditions to deliver solutions tailored to client needs ensuring compliance with SEL standards and requirements.
Develop, maintain and deliver upon quarterly orders forecasts and sales goals.
Collect, analyze and report industry, competitor and customer trends to the greater SEL organization.
Work collaboratively to understand and drive the resolution of customer feedback and product issues.
Liaise between customers, SEL factories, contracts & risk, and accounts receivable to facilitate commercial relationships.
Utilize business tools to maintain customer relationship information, opportunity tracking and sales activities.
Help develop strategics annual plans for Central America and Caribbean countries.
This job might be for you if possess the following:
B.S. in Electrical Engineering or related engineering discipline or equivalent combination of education and/or work experience in technical sales
3 or more years of experience in an electrical engineering or technical sales environment
US citizenship or US green card
Fluent in both writing and speaking English and Spanish
Demonstrated success working in a customer-facing role
Ability to travel 70% of the time
Effective and engaging communication skills
Excellent negotiation skills to manage client expectations, align on terms and secure contracts that meet both customer and SEL objectives
Ability to learn new skills and assume new responsibilities
Ability to work cooperatively in a team environment
Preferred Qualifications
Master's degree in Business Administration, Management, or related discipline
Experience using SEL products
Utility and Industrial industry experience in CA&C region.
Leadership experience
Location

This position is located in Trinity, FL. Just a 40-minute drive to Tampa, where you can enjoy vibrant downtown and beautiful waterfront views. Trinity offers easy access to stunning beaches, outdoor recreation, and native wildlife. The area is known for its breathtaking natural beauty, pristine parks, and friendly community atmosphere. Trinity is rapidly growing and boasts excellent shopping and dining options, making it a wonderful place to live and work.
Competitive pay. Superior benefits. Inspiring work.
People are at the core of our company and we hire employee-owners. We welcome you to learn more about how we support employees.
We're 100% employee owned. Retirement benefits include an employer funded stock ownership plan (ESOP) and personal 401K options.
We offer top tier medical, prescription, dental, vision, life, and disability insurance.

We recognize the importance of a healthy life balance and offer: 10 paid holidays, annual vacation accrual starting at 12 days, 9 paid sick days, and paid family and medical leave that covers 90% of your pay.
We foster growth and development of our employees through avenues such as STEM courses, apprenticeships, tuition assistance, and engineering development programs.

1005404,https://oilandgasjobsearch.com/jobs/engineering-jobs/1005404,Onshore Export Cable Engineer,,,,,,"We have a current opportunity for a Onshore Export Cable Engineer on a contract basis with a leading UK offshore wind project. The main office location will be London, however project sites are located across north Wales and Lancashire.

Working with onshore export cables and their associated civils and installation is your expertise, and you are passionate about a future powered by sustainable energy. With a decade of hands-on experience in designing, building, and managing offshore wind farms, you'll find yourself right at home in a corporate setting. Anticipate a diverse and engaging array of responsibilities that are as thrilling as they are significant.
Responsibilities:
You will be part of the interdisciplinary sub-project ""Onshore Export Cable""
* You will effectively collaborate on Civils and cable installation on onshore cable routes from the Landfall to the point of connection at NG substations.
* You will report to the Lead Civil Engineer and support him within the following scope and functions.
* You will help manage internal and external studies and consultancies for specific engineering scopes.

* You will be required to support and help and actively participate in the preparation of technical specifications for the civils and duct installation as well as the supply and installation, jointing, terminating and testing of onshore export cables.
* You will be required to have an understanding of the preparation, negotiation and award of contracts and examination and evaluation of offered technical solutions.

* You are to support the Lead Civil Engineer in design, FEED and the construction and consenting processes, (This also includes reviews of documents and the delivered technical solutions for compliance with specified requirements)
* You will help manage the internal interfaces to the survey team, and onshore export cable package.
* On top of that, you will play a key role in helping to strengthen interfaces to other work packages.
* Once the works commence on site, then this role will transition into an Onshore Engineer Site Representative role, reporting to the Lead Civil Engineer on a daily basis.
Education / Training:
* You have a degree or a comparable qualification in Civil Engineering or Electrical Engineering
* Alternatively, you have a technical/ skilled worker formation plus extensive professional experience in the respective field.
Experience & Job Requirements:

* You have a very good demonstrable knowledge of civils works associated with the installation of long linear onshore cable routes including trenchless crossing techniques, 3rd party asset crossings, including Network Rail assets, land and consents interfaces, jointing & terminating of HV cables commissioning and HV testing. A sound knowledge of CDM 2015 and current H&S Legislation is required and at least 5 years of professional experience in a comparable position.
* You are motivated, dedicated and ready to embrace new challenges and take initiative and ownership.
* Furthermore, experience in participating contract negotiations and in contract management of large infrastructure investment projects is desirable
* You demonstrate willingness to familiarize yourself with new tasks at a short notice
* You are willing to travel within the scope of project requirements
* And of course, you are a strong team player with good communication and persuasion skills, who enjoys working within intercultural teams
Our role in supporting diversity and inclusion

As an international workforce business, we are committed to sourcing personnel that reflects the diversity and values of our client base but also that of Orion Group.
